cate: <entryFree id="n7079" type="main" key="ca^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. catus <sense id="n7079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
catechesis: <entryFree id="n7080" type="greek" key="ca^te_che_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēchēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kath/xhsis</foreign>; <sense id="n7080.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in eccl. Lat.,</quote> <trans><tr>religious instruction</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 61, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
catechismus: <entryFree id="n7081" type="greek" key="ca^te_chismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēchismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kathxismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a book of elementary Christian instruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a catechism</hi>, Aug. de Fide et Oper. 13.</sense></entryFree>
catechista: <entryFree id="n7082" type="greek" key="ca^te_chista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēchista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kathxisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a religious teacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catechist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 50, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catechizo: <entryFree id="n7083" type="main" key="ca^te_chi_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēchīzo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-isso</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kathxizw</foreign>, <sense id="n7083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to instruct in religion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to catechise</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idol. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catechumenus: <entryFree id="n7084" type="greek" key="ca^te_chu_me^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēchūmĕnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kathxou/menos, h</foreign>, <sense id="n7084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who is receiving elementary instruction in religion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a catechumen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 41</bibl> et saep.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Euseb. 169" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. ad Euseb. 169</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
categoria: <entryFree id="n7085" type="greek" key="ca^te_go^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēgŏrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kathgori/a</foreign> (postclass.). <sense id="n7085.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An accusation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 82, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3</bibl> (where others write it as a Greek word).—</sense><sense id="n7085.1" n="II" level="1"> In logic, <hi rend="ital">a predicament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">category</hi> or <hi rend="ital">class of predicables</hi> (pure Lat. praedicamenta): <cit><quote lang="la">Aristotelicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl>: Aristotelica quaedam, quas appellat decem categorias, Aug. Conf. <cb n="CATE" /> 4, 16; Serg. Expl. in Art. Don. p. 487, 25 Keil.</sense></entryFree>
categoricus: <entryFree id="n7086" type="greek" key="ca^te_go^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēgŏrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kathgoriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to a category</hi>, <hi rend="ital">categorical</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> de Dial. p. 513</bibl>, A.</sense></entryFree>
cateia: <entryFree id="n7087" type="foreign" key="ca^te_ia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Celt. or Germ.</etym>, <sense id="n7087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of spear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">probably barbed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 741</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:277" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 277</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:83" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 2</bibl>; cf. Serv. ad Verg. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catella: <entryFree id="n7088" type="main" key="ca^tella1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 1. catellus.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n7089" type="main" key="ca^tella2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătella</orth>, v. 2. catellus.</entryFree>
catellulus: <entryFree id="n7090" type="gloss" key="ca^tellu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătellŭlus</orth>, <lbl>dim.</lbl> from catellus, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 313</bibl> P.</entryFree>
catellus: <entryFree id="n7091" type="main" key="ca^tellus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cătella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>catulus, canis</etym>, <sense id="n7091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little dog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puppy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whelp.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7091.1" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 40</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 94, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 103</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:84" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:551" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 551</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:61" default="NO">9, 61</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and as a term of endearment,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 259</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7091.2" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:654" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 654</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and as a term of endearment: mi catella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7092" type="main" key="ca^tellus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and far more freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cătella</orth> (once not contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēnŭla</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 26, 462</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>catena; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 556</bibl> P.</etym>, <sense id="n7092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small chain.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7092.1" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, in a play on the meaning of 1. catellus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7092.2" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 1</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 199, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:31:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 31, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaginae catellis crepitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 152</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 31, 15</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=273:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 273, 12</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
catena: <entryFree id="n7093" type="main" key="ca^te_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (once with <sense id="n7093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distrib.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">piur.</hi> tantum: <cit><quote lang="la">trinis catenis vinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>) [Sanscr. kat, to fall away; cf. catax]. </sense><sense id="n7093.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wooden bracket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brace</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">for holding two beams together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7093.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A chain</hi>, </sense><sense id="n7093.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Used as a fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shackle</hi>, etc.; usu. in <number>plur.</number> (syn. vincula): <cit><quote lang="la">catenis vincire aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:601 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 601 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenas indere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in catenas conicere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 21, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenas inicere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in catenis aliquem Romam mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 21, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in catenis aliquem per urbem ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximere se ex catenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere catenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenas alicui exsolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 31 al.</bibl></cit>—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 297</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 558</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:36" default="NO">7, 5, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 15, 43, § 150</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7093.4" n="2" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">a chain stopping the entrance of a harbor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">catena ferrea valde robusta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7093.5" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a constraint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bond</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taetra belua, constricta legum sacratarum catenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compesce animum frenis, catenā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validā teneamur catenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:5:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:117" default="NO">4, 1, 117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidiore nunc eos catenā sed multo graviore vinctos esse, quam cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 38, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ad superiora progressus est.. laxam catenam trahit nondum liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 10, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7093.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A chain of gold or silver worn by women as an ornament</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 12, § 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7093.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A series of things connected together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">series</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:910" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 910</bibl> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 630</bibl>, is a false reading for quod armis; v. Lachm.).—</sense><sense id="n7093.8" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(praecepta oratoria) in catenas ligare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
catenarius: <entryFree id="n7094" type="main" key="ca^te_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>catena</etym>, <sense id="n7094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a chain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <trans><tr>a dog fastened by a chain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:37:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 37, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 72, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catenatio: <entryFree id="n7095" type="main" key="ca^te_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <sense id="n7095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [cateno; lit. a binding; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, abstr pro concr.],</quote> <trans><tr>a band</tr>, <tr>clamp</tr>, <tr>clincher</tr>, <tr>pin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cateno: <entryFree id="n7096" type="main" key="ca^te_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēno</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>catena</etym>, <sense id="n7096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to chain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bind together</hi> (prob. not ante-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:19:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 19, 2</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> Ven. Carm. 2, 14; cf.: cateno, <foreign lang="greek">pede/w</foreign>, Gloss. Vet.—More freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">bound with a chain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fettered</hi>: Britannus, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">janitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl>, praef. § 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:64 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 64 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:731" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 731</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestrae (on account of their twining their limbs around one another),</quote> <trans><tr>intertwined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7096.1" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus ex pluribus syllabis catenatos,</quote> <trans><tr>connected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <trans><tr>continued</tr>, <tr>unremitting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
catenula: <entryFree id="n7097" type="main" key="ca^te_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătēnŭla</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen>, v. 2. catellus.</entryFree>
caterva: <entryFree id="n7098" type="main" key="ca^terva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căterva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a band</hi> <cb n="CATI" /> <hi rend="ital">of men;</hi> in the <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number> (class. in prose and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn.: turba, manus, agmen). </sense><sense id="n7098.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">comitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 628</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 611</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 497</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 533</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 216</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Postumius obviam cum bene magnā catervā suā venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 33, 69</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 184</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">catervae testium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:43:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 43, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra dicentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:47 al" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 47 al.</bibl></cit>— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1092" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1092</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avium,</quote> <trans><tr>flocks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 151, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguinea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:87" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7098.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: verborum. <hi rend="ital">a farrago of words</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7098.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n7098.4" n="A" level="2"> In milit. lang. freq., <hi rend="ital">a body of soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a troop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">company</hi>, <hi rend="ital">band;</hi> esp. of the loose order of barbarian nations (opp. to the Roman legions); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 3, 46</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 45</bibl>; 12, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:67" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 593</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 16 al.</bibl>—Of <hi rend="ital">foot-soldiers</hi> (opp. equites), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:804" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 804</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 433</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 190</bibl>.—Rare of Roman troops, Petr. poët. 124, 281; <cit><quote lang="la">or of cavalry,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 598" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 598</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7098.5" n="B" level="2"> In dramatic lang., <hi rend="ital">the whole company</hi> or <hi rend="ital">troop of actors</hi> (usu. called grex). Plaut. Capt. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; and perh. also id. Cas. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. Cic. de. Or 3, 50, 196; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Sest. 55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sest. 55</bibl>. 118.</sense></entryFree>
catervarius: <entryFree id="n7099" type="main" key="ca^terva_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătervārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caterva</etym>, <sense id="n7099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a crowd</hi> or <hi rend="ital">troop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugiles,</quote> <trans><tr>fighting in bands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">catervae pugilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 18</bibl></cit>); <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2530</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catervatim: <entryFree id="n7100" type="main" key="ca^terva_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătervātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in companies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in troops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 556</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 41, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:19:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 24, 35, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catharticum: <entryFree id="n7101" type="greek" key="ca^tharti^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căthartĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaqartiko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n7101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of purifying, a cathartic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 7, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cathedra: <entryFree id="n7102" type="greek" key="ca^the_^dra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căthē^dra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaqe/dra</foreign>, <sense id="n7102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stool</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">one furnished with cushions and supports for women</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an arm-chair.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7102.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 5, 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:91 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 91 al.</bibl>; also, <hi rend="ital">a sedan chair</hi>, Juv 1, 65; 9, 52 Rup. al.; cf. Dict. of Antiq.—</sense><sense id="n7102.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a teacher</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s</hi> or <hi rend="ital">professor</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s chair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:203" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:77" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 77 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7102.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the office of teacher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usurpare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 10, 1</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">of a bishop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cathedralicius: <entryFree id="n7103" type="hapax" key="ca^the_^dra_li^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căthē^drālĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cathedra</etym>, <sense id="n7103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to an arm-chair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>effeminate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:13:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cathedrarius: <entryFree id="n7104" type="main" key="ca^the_^dra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căthē^drārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to an arm-chair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsellia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:10:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi,</quote> <trans><tr>who carry a chair</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7104.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the chair</hi> or <hi rend="ital">office of a teacher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi,</quote> <trans><tr>teachers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 10:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 10, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. cathedra, II.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oratores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
catheter: <entryFree id="n7105" type="greek" key="ca^the^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căthĕter</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaqeth/r</foreign>, <sense id="n7105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surgical instrument for drawing off the urine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a catheter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:13 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 13 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
catheterismus: <entryFree id="n7106" type="greek" key="ca^the^te_rismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căthĕtērismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaqethrismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the application of the catheter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:23" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cathetus: <entryFree id="n7107" type="greek" key="cathe^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cathĕtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/qetos</foreign> (that is sunk down), <sense id="n7107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a perpendicular line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a perpendicular</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 10, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catholice: <entryFree id="n7108" type="main" key="ca^tho^li^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căthŏlĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. catholicus.</entryFree>
catholicus: <entryFree id="n7109" type="greek" key="ca^tho^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căthŏlĭcus</orth> (catholicus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 70</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaqoliko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">universal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relating to all</hi> (post - Aug.; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 14</bibl> as Greek, transl. by universalis and perpetualis; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:5:46" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 5, 46</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">catholica et summa bonitas Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">căthŏlĭcē</orth>: in medium proferre. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 26</bibl>.—More freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">căthŏlĭca</orth>, ōrum. <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the universe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anne caelestes dii catholicorum dominantur?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. 39, p. 100, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catholica siderum,</quote> <trans><tr>general properties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, epit. 2, n. 15; so, fulgurum, id. n. 55 —</sense><sense id="n7109.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Orthodox</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catholic</hi> (eccl. Lat.): fides, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 11, 24 et saep.: ecclesia, Cod. Th. 16, 5, 47 al.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">căthŏlĭcē</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ruf. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cati: <entryFree id="n7110" type="gloss" key="Ca^ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căti fons</orth>, <sense id="n7110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fountain of Catus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from which the</hi> aqua Petronia <hi rend="ital">flows into the Tiber</hi>, named from a certain Catus. in whose field it was, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=45" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 45</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
catia: <entryFree id="n7111" type="main" key="Ca^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catianus: <entryFree id="n7112" type="main" key="Ca^ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Catius, II. <pb n="302" /> <cb n="CATI" /></entryFree>
catiena: <entryFree id="n7113" type="main" key="Ca^ti^e_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătĭēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:133" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catienus: <entryFree id="n7114" type="main" key="Ca^ti^e_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătĭēnus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n7114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catilina: <entryFree id="n7115" type="main" key="Ca^ti^li_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătĭlīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. catus</etym>. <sense id="n7115.0" n="I" level="1"> L. Sergius, <hi rend="ital">Catiline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman who was notorious for several times attempting insurrections against his country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 668</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7115.1" n="B" level="2"> Appel. <hi rend="ital">of a great conspirator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:41" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 41</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7115.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătĭlīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Catiline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Catilinarian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seminarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 9</bibl></cit> (Cod. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:Ambros. 1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> Ambros. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilinae, cf. Zumpt, Suppl. ad h. l.): prodigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 51, 52, § 137</bibl></cit> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 2, 8, § 34</bibl></cit> ib.</sense></entryFree>
catilius: <entryFree id="n7116" type="main" key="Ca^ti_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătīlĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n7116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catillamen: <entryFree id="n7117" type="main" key="ca^tilla_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătillāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>catillo</etym>, <sense id="n7117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">junket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweetmeat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catillatio: <entryFree id="n7118" type="gloss" key="ca^tilla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătillātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>; lit., <sense id="n7118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a licking of plates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plundering of provinces friendly to the Roman people</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=44" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 44</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
catillo: <entryFree id="n7119" type="main" key="ca^tillo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătillo</orth>, <itype>ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. catillus</etym>, <sense id="n7119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lick a plate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 22</bibl>; Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 563, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7120" type="main" key="ca^tillo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătillo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. catillo</etym>, <sense id="n7120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a platelicker;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a glutton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gourmand</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=44" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 44</bibl> (where the best MSS. have catiliones); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 90</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
catillum: <entryFree id="n7121" type="main" key="ca^tillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. catillus <sense id="n7121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
catillus: <entryFree id="n7122" type="main" key="ca^tillus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<number>plur.</number> heterocl. <itype>catilla, ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 50, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 556</bibl> P.; an uncontr. access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">că-tīnŭlus</orth>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 61</bibl> ib.), <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>catinus</etym>. <sense id="n7122.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small bowl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dish</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">plate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 84 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Asin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 61</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:57:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 57, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7122.1" n="II" level="1"> Of objects in the form of a plate. </sense><sense id="n7122.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An ornament on a sword-sheath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 152</bibl> (catellis, Jan. and Sill.).—</sense><sense id="n7122.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The upper millstone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7123" type="main" key="Ca_tillus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cātillus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cātĭlus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 2</bibl>; <sense id="n7123.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Cātillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:100" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 100</bibl></cit>; cf. on the measure <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 36</bibl> Lachm.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a son of Amphiaraus; he with his brothers Tiburtus and Coras built Tibur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 672</bibl> Serv.; 11, 640; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:366" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 366</bibl>; cf. Sol. c. 8.</sense></entryFree>
catina: <entryFree id="n7124" type="main" key="Ca^ti^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătĭna</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătăna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătănē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:196" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 196</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kata/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n7124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the east coast of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the foot of Ætna</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Catania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:75:section=185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 75, § 185</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 83, § 192 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7124.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătĭnensis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătĭnĭensis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătă-nensis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 4, 28</bibl>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Catina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Catina</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:8:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 8, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pumex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Manlius Catinensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 30, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătĭnenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Catina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:49:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 49, § 120</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 43, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catinulus: <entryFree id="n7125" type="main" key="ca^ti_nu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătīnŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. catillus.</entryFree>
catinum: <entryFree id="n7126" type="main" key="ca^ti_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. catinus <sense id="n7126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
catinus: <entryFree id="n7127" type="main" key="ca^ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cătīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 84, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 556</bibl> P.; on the contr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 60</bibl> ib.) [kindr. with the Siculian <foreign lang="greek">ka/tinon</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=120, p. 35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 120, p. 35</bibl> Bip.; cf. O. Müll. Etrusk. 1, p. 13; cf. also Sanscr. katina, vas fictile], <sense id="n7127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deep vessel for serving up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cooking food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bowl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:63:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 63, 1</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 546, 14</bibl>; Maecen. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 61</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 39</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 4, 77 al.—Also for melting metals,</quote> <trans><tr>a crucible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:107" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 6, 35, § 107</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for incense,</quote> <trans><tr>a censer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7127.1" n="II" level="1"> Of things of similar form. </sense><sense id="n7127.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The air-vessel in a hydraulic instrument</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:7:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 7, 1 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7127.3" n="B" level="2"> Saxi, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> (<hi rend="ital">natural</hi>) <hi rend="ital">hollow in a rock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 32, § 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catius: <entryFree id="n7128" type="main" key="Ca^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n7128.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the protector of boys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom he made intelligent</hi> (catos), Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 21.—</sense><sense id="n7128.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Epicurean philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of works</hi> de rerum naturā, de summo bono, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 1</bibl>; Cass. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 15, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 124</bibl>; Schol. Cruq. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7128.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; Cass. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 15, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7128.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A feigned name</hi> in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 1</bibl> and 88. <cb n="CATU" /></sense></entryFree>
cativolcus: <entryFree id="n7129" type="main" key="Cativolcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cativolcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">king of the Eburones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catlaster: <entryFree id="n7130" type="main" key="catlaster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">catlaster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contr. for catulaster from catulus; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 65</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 618</bibl> ib. and 628 ib.</etym>, <sense id="n7130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stripling</hi>: catulaster <foreign lang="greek">bou/pais, pa/llhc</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 24</bibl> Schneid. (p. 242 Bip. catastros).</sense></entryFree>
catlitio: <entryFree id="n7131" type="main" key="catli_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">catlītio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. catulitio.</entryFree>
cato: <entryFree id="n7132" type="main" key="Ca^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căto</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. catus</etym>, <sense id="n7132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cognomen of several celebrated Romans in the</hi> gens Porcia, Valeria, Vettia al. </sense><sense id="n7132.1" n="I" level="1"> M. Porcius Cato <hi rend="ital">the elder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished as a rigid judge of morals;</hi> hence with the appel. Censorius; <cit><quote lang="la">whose most celebrated works were the Origines and De Re Rustica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 27, 28, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:112" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 30, 31, § 112</bibl>; cf., concerning him, Bernhardy, Röm. Litt. p. 521 sq.; 650; Bähr, <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. p. 515; 258; 354 al.; <cit><quote lang="la">Ellendt, Cic. Brut. p. xix.-xxv.—As appel. of a severe judge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 7, 21</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7132.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Cato</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:4:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 4, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 7:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (i. e. praecepta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 94, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of high morality</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:27:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 27, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7132.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">His descendant</hi>, M. Porcius Cato <hi rend="ital">the younger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the enemy of Cœsar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who committed suicide after the battle of Pharsalia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at Utica;</hi> hence <hi rend="ital">with the appel.</hi> Uticensis.—</sense><sense id="n7132.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătōnīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the adherents</hi> or <hi rend="ital">friends of Cato</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 25, 1</bibl>; cf. catonium.—Concerning both, and the Porcian family in gen., v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20</bibl> Hertz, p. 19 Bip.—On account of their serious and austere character, <hi rend="ital">serious</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">morose men</hi> are called Catones, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 120:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 120, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7132.5" n="III" level="1"> Valerius Cato, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated grammarian of Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and poet of the time of Sulla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:436" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 436</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7132.6" n="IV" level="1"> Dionysius Cato, <hi rend="ital">author of the</hi> Disticha de moribus, prob. <hi rend="ital">about the time of Constantine;</hi> v. the Disticha, with the Sententiae of Syrus, at the end of the Fabulae of Phaedrus, Bip.</sense></entryFree>
catoblepas: <entryFree id="n7133" type="greek" key="ca^to_ble^pas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătōblĕpas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">katw=\bley</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">katwble/pwn</foreign> (that looks down), <sense id="n7133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild animal in Ethiopia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perhaps a species of buffalo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or the gnu</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a species of antelope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:9:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 32, § 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catocha: <entryFree id="n7134" type="greek" key="ca^to^cha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătŏcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">katoxh/</foreign>, <sense id="n7134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a complete stupor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catalepsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Ac. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Ac. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catochitis: <entryFree id="n7135" type="greek" key="ca^to^chi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătŏchītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">katoxi=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n7135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone found in Corsica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catomidio: <entryFree id="n7136" type="greek" key="ca^to_mi^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătōmĭdĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">katwmi/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n7136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay one over the shoulders of another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and thus to flog him;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">to strike on the shoulders</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catomitarii: <entryFree id="n7137" type="hapax" key="catomitarii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">catomitarii</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">catomecarii</orth>, a word of unknown signif. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 329</bibl>.</entryFree>
catomus: <entryFree id="n7138" type="greek" key="ca^to_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătōmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">kat) w)/mous</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n7138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the shoulders</hi> (late Lat.): catomus cervix, Gloss.: catomis caedi, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 142</bibl>; cf. catomidio.</sense></entryFree>
catonianus: <entryFree id="n7139" type="main" key="Ca^to_ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Cato, I. B.</entryFree>
catonini: <entryFree id="n7140" type="main" key="Ca^to_ni_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătōnīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Cato, II. B.</entryFree>
catonium: <entryFree id="n7141" type="greek" key="ca^to_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ka/tw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n7141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Lower World</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 4</bibl>; cf. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:page=65" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> p. 65</bibl> Cram.—Hence the play upon the word: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor, ne in catonium Catoninos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 25, 1</bibl></cit> B. and K. (others read catomum; v. this word).</sense></entryFree>
catoptritis: <entryFree id="n7142" type="greek" key="ca^toptri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătoptrītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">katoptri=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n7142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone found in Cappadocia</hi>, unknown to us, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 152</bibl> Sill. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
catorchites: <entryFree id="n7143" type="greek" key="ca^torchi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătorchītes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vīnum</orth>), = <foreign lang="greek">katorxi/ths oi)=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n7143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wine made from figs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catta: <entryFree id="n7144" type="hapax" key="catta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">catta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown species of animal</hi> (acc. to Gloss. Vet. = <foreign lang="greek">ai)/louros</foreign>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the Germ. Kater, Katze, cat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:69:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 69, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
catti: <entryFree id="n7145" type="main" key="Catti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Catti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Chatti.</entryFree>
catula: <entryFree id="n7146" type="main" key="ca^tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. catulus.</entryFree>
catularia: <entryFree id="n7147" type="gloss" key="Ca^tu^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătŭlārĭa Porta</orth>, <sense id="n7147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the gates of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called because dogs were sacrificed near it</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=45" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 45</bibl> Müll.; cf. Becker, Röm. Alterth. 1, p. 178 sq.</sense></entryFree>
catulaster: <entryFree id="n7148" type="gloss" key="ca^tu^laster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătŭlaster</orth>, v. catlaster.</entryFree>
catulinus: <entryFree id="n7149" type="main" key="ca^tu^li_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătŭlīnus</orth>, a. <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>catulus</etym>, <sense id="n7149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a little dog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dog</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-</hi>: caro, Plaut. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=45" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 45</bibl> Müll.; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cătŭlīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. caro), <hi rend="ital">the flesh of the dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 14, § 58</bibl>. <cb n="CAUC" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7150" type="main" key="Ca^tu^li_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătŭlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n7150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of Q. Lutatius Catulus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 17</bibl> Sill. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
catulio: <entryFree id="n7151" type="main" key="ca^tu^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătŭlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>catulus</etym>, <sense id="n7151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to desire the male</hi>, of dogs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 11</bibl>; of the she-wolf, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 90, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catulitio: <entryFree id="n7152" type="main" key="ca^tu^li_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătŭlītĭo</orth>, or contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">catlītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>catulio</etym>, <sense id="n7152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a desire for the male;</hi> trop. of nature (gestiente natură semina accipere), a rustic expression, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 39, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catullus: <entryFree id="n7153" type="main" key="Ca^tullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n7153.0" n="I" level="1"> Q. Valerius, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 21, § 81</bibl>; C. acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 10, p. 12</bibl> Bip., <hi rend="ital">a celebrated Roman writer of elegies and epigrams</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born near</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in Verona</hi>, 86 B. C.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6</bibl> 41; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:99" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 99</bibl>; cf. Bernhardy, Röm. Litt. p. 466 sq.; Bähr, <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. p. 184 sq.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7153.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătullĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Catullus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">basia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:6:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7153.2" n="II" level="1"> Catullus Urbicarius, <hi rend="ital">a mimographer of the time of Domitian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:186" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:29" default="NO">12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:37" default="NO">12, 37</bibl>; 13, 111.—</sense><sense id="n7153.3" n="III" level="1"> Catullus Messalinus, <hi rend="ital">an informer of the same time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:113" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 22, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
catuloticus: <entryFree id="n7154" type="greek" key="ca^tu_lo_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătūlōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">katoulwtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">good for healing over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 28, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
catulus: <entryFree id="n7155" type="main" key="ca^tu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. catus</etym>, <sense id="n7155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the young of animals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a whelp;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 457, 8 sq.</bibl> </sense><sense id="n7155.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., of swine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a panther,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1036" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1036</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a lion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 245</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 547</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a tiger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 4, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a cat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a wolf,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 357</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a bear,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 836</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 379</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a serpent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:438 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 438 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in gen.: catulos ferae Celent inultae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7155.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a young dog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a puppy</hi> (in this sense regarded by the ancients as <lbl>dim.</lbl> of canis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=74" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 74</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">99 ib.): omnia in perfectis et maturis esse meliora, ut in equo quam in equulo, in cane quam in catulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:14:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catulo meo Subblanditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 321</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:997" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 997</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1067" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1067</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 405</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 14, § 57</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n7155.3" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter catuli longe olent, aliter sues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7155.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of fetter</hi> (cf. canis), Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 36, 26</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=45" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 45</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7156" type="main" key="Ca^tu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cognomen in the</hi> gens Lutatia; v. Lutatius.</sense></entryFree>
caturiges: <entryFree id="n7157" type="main" key="Ca^tu^ri^ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cătŭrĭges</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Ligurian tribe in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, now <hi rend="ital">De/partement des Hautes-Alpes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:20:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24</bibl>, §§ 135 and 137.</sense></entryFree>
catus: <entryFree id="n7158" type="main" key="ca^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root ka-; Sanscr. ça-, to whet, sharpen; cf. cos, cautes, cuneus; Sabine, = acutus, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=46, p. 90" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 46, p. 90</bibl> Bip.</etym>. * <sense id="n7158.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sharp to the hearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear-sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrill</hi> (cf. acutus, 2.): jam cata signa fere sonitum dare voce parabant, Enn. ap. Varr. l. l. (Ann. 447 Vahl.). —</sense><sense id="n7158.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to intellectual objects, in a good and bad sense. </sense><sense id="n7158.2" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">clear-sighted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sagacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wise</hi>, opp. stultus (in prose probably never naturalized; hence Cic., in prose, adds ut ita dicam; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>): catus Aelius Sextus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 18</bibl> (Ann. v. 335 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 14</bibl> Don. and Ruhnk.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudens et, ut ita dicam, catus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:16:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 16, 45</bibl></cit>.—Constr. with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 400</bibl></cit>.—Of abstract things: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:519" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 519</bibl></cit> Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7158.3" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">sly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crafty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artful</hi> ( = callidus, astutus): <cit><quote lang="la">cata est et callida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 71</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 39</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cătē</orth>, conform. to II. A.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapienter, docte et cordate et cate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=304" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 304</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> not in use in the <pos>adj.</pos> or in the <pos>adv.</pos></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7159" type="main" key="ca^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cătus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a male cat</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 9, 4</bibl>; scanned, cātus, Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. 5, p. 162, 3 al.</sense></entryFree>
caucalis: <entryFree id="n7160" type="greek" key="cauca^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caucălis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaukali/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an umbelliferous plant;</hi> acc. to Sprengel Caucalis orientalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 52, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:83" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 40, § 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caucasigena: <entryFree id="n7161" type="main" key="Cauca^si^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caucăsĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Caucasus-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n7161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near the Caucasus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caucasus: <entryFree id="n7162" type="main" key="Cauca^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caucăsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kau/kasos</foreign>. <sense id="n7162.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The rough Caucasian chain of mountains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in.habited by wild tribes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Asia, between the</hi> <pb n="303" /> <cb n="CAUD" /> <hi rend="ital">Black and Caspian Seas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhospitalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 1, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 366</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Gr. Caucason, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 798</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:394" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 394</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7162.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caucă-sĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Caucasus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Caucasian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO">2, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:69" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 25, 14: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: Portae, <hi rend="ital">a narrow pass between the Caucasus and the</hi> mare Hyrcanum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 11, 12, § 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7162.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A name of a horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:357" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 357</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cauci: <entryFree id="n7163" type="main" key="Cauci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cauci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Chauci.</entryFree>
caucula: <entryFree id="n7164" type="hapax" key="caucu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caucŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>from the unus. cauca, v. caucus</etym>, <sense id="n7164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small dish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, 20, p. 62</bibl> Min. Vit. Debr.</sense></entryFree>
cauculator: <entryFree id="n7165" type="gloss" key="caucu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caucŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reckoner</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">yhfisth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. [ = calculator].</sense></entryFree>
caucus: <entryFree id="n7166" type="greek" key="caucus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caucus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kau=ka</foreign>, <sense id="n7166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinkingvessel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jov. 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cauda: <entryFree id="n7167" type="main" key="cauda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cauda</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōda</orth>, <itype>like codex, plostrum</itype>, etc., Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 86, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=178:29" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 178, 29</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=38:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 38, 17</bibl> Müll.) [etym. dub.; cf. codex], <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the tail</hi> of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 806</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:658" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 658</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 50, 111, § 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R.
