R. 2, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:5:8" default="NO">2, 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7167.1" n="2" level="3"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n7167.2" n="a" level="4"> Caudam jactare popello, <hi rend="ital">to flatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fawn upon</hi> (the figure taken from dogs), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:15" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7167.3" n="b" level="4"> Caudam trahere, <hi rend="ital">to have a tail stuck on in mockery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be made a fool of</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:83:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 83, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium bono viro quasi caudam turpissimam apponere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 18, 16</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n7167.4" n="3" level="3"> In a pun, <hi rend="ital">the end of the word</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the tail of the animal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 191</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7167.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrum virile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7167.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the addition to the name Verres, making it Verrucius: <cit><quote lang="la">videtis extremam partem nominis, codam illam Verrinam tamquam in luto demersam in liturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 191</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caudeus: <entryFree id="n7168" type="hapax" key="caude^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caudĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>instead of caudĭcĕus, from caudex</etym>, <sense id="n7168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wooden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cistella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 65</bibl></cit>; access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">caudĕcus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: caudecae cistellae ex junco, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
caudex: <entryFree id="n7169" type="main" key="caudex1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caudex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (more recent orthography <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōdex</orth>) [etym. dub.; cf. cauda]. <sense id="n7169.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The trunk of a tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stem</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n7169.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Caudex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 53, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 15, 34, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 30</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n7169.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Codex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:21" default="NO">5, 6, 21</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n7169.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The block of wood to which one was bound for punishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">codex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 44; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 57</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7169.4" n="C" level="2"> A term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">block</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dolt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blockhead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7169.5" n="II" level="1"> Inpartic. </sense><sense id="n7169.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A block of wood split</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sawn into planks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leaves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tablets</hi> and <hi rend="ital">fastened together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia plurium tabularum contextus caudex apud antiquos vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: quod antiqui pluris tabulas conjunctas codices dicebant, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 535, 20</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7169.7" n="B" level="2"> (Since the ancients orig. wrote upon tablets of wood smeared with wax.) <hi rend="ital">A book</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a writing</hi> (its leaves were not, like the volumina, rolled within one another, but, like those of our books, lay over one another; cf. Dict. of Antiq.). </sense><sense id="n7169.8" n="(a)" level="5"> Caudex, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Ant. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Ant. 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7169.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Codex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 33, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:52 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 52 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7169.10" n="C" level="2"> Esp. of <hi rend="ital">an accountbook</hi> and particularly of <hi rend="ital">a ledger</hi> (while adversaria signifies the waste-book; hence only the former was of any validity in law): non habere se hoc nomen (<hi rend="ital">this item</hi>) in codice accepti et expensi relatum confitetur: <cit><quote lang="la">sed in adversariis patere contendit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; v. the passage in connection; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9</bibl>: in codicis extremā cerā (i. e. <hi rend="ital">upon the last tablet</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 36</bibl>. § <cit><quote lang="la">92: referre in codicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 15, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7169.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A code of laws</hi>: Codex Theodosianus, Justinianus, etc.; cf. Dict. of Antiq. s. v.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7170" type="main" key="Caudex2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caudex</orth>, <itype>cis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>: App. Claudius Caudex, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 490, B. C. 264, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:37" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caudicalis: <entryFree id="n7171" type="hapax" key="caudi^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caudĭcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caudex</etym>, <sense id="n7171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the trunks of trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of wood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia, humorously,</quote> <trans><tr>the employment of woodsplitting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caudicarius: <entryFree id="n7172" type="main" key="caudi^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caudĭcārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cōdĭc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the trunks of trees</hi>: naves, <hi rend="ital">made of rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stout trunks of trees</hi> <cb n="CAUN" /> (cf. caudex, II.), Varr. and Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 535, 15 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 13, 4</bibl>; cf. also Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl> Müll.: caudicariae naves ex tabulis grossioribus factae.— Hence, patroni caudicarii, <hi rend="ital">masters of such ships</hi>, Cod. Th. 14, 4, 9.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">caudĭ-cārĭi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōdĭcārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">those who sail on such ships</hi> (esp. <hi rend="ital">those who brought the corn from Ostia to Rome</hi>), Cod. Th. 14, 3, 2; 14, 15, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1084</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3178 al.</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 3, 2, p. 92.</sense></entryFree>
caudiceus: <entryFree id="n7173" type="hapax" key="caudi^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caudĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caudex</etym>, <sense id="n7173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the trunk of a tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lembus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 197</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caudium: <entryFree id="n7174" type="main" key="Caudium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caudium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n7174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small but ancient city of Samnium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Benevento</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for the narrow mountain pass</hi> (the Furculae Caudinae) <hi rend="ital">where the Roman army was shut in by the Samnites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 30, 109</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7174.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caudīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Caudium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Caudine</hi>: Furculae Caudinae, <hi rend="ital">the Caudine Forks</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Casale di Forchia</hi> (al. <hi rend="ital">Forchia d</hi>'<hi rend="ital">Arpaia</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16, 9</bibl>.—The same called Furcae Caudinae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 137</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Caudinae Fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:566" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 566</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:132" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samnites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:41:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 41, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caudīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Caudium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caulae: <entryFree id="n7175" type="main" key="caulae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caulae</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">caullae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>apparently contr. from cavile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=20, p. 8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 20, p. 8</bibl> Bip., from cavus; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl></etym>. <sense id="n7175.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an opening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi> (so most freq. in Lucr.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:951" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 951</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:707" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 707</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per caulas corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 255</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:702" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 702</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:839" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 839</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per caulas palati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 620</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:660" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 660</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per caulas aetheris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 492</bibl></cit>: intra caulas (aedis Saturni), Lex Corn. XX Quaest. 2, 41; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caulae (Jani) pace clauduntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 374 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 374 sq.</bibl> Lachm. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n7175.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n7175.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sheepfold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cote</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 60</bibl> Serv.—* </sense><sense id="n7175.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An enclosure,</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 191, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caulares: <entryFree id="n7176" type="main" key="Caula_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caulāres</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Pamphylia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caulias: <entryFree id="n7177" type="greek" key="caulias"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caulias</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kauli/as</foreign>, <sense id="n7177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">taken</hi> or <hi rend="ital">derived from the stalk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus, opp. to rhizias (from the root),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cauliculatus: <entryFree id="n7178" type="main" key="cauli^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caulĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cauliculus</etym>, <sense id="n7178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">having a stalk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cauliculus: <entryFree id="n7179" type="main" key="cauli^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caulĭcŭlus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>caulis</etym>, <sense id="n7179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the small stalk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stem of a plant;</hi> form cauliculus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 128" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 128</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form coliculus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 158, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:42:4" default="NO">1, 42, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:7:1" default="NO">12, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:56:1" default="NO">12, 56, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7179.1" n="II" level="1"> In architecture, <hi rend="ital">a stalk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stem as an ornament on the capitals of columns</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caulis: <entryFree id="n7180" type="main" key="caulis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caulis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cōlis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:41:6" default="NO">1, 41, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:36" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 9, 2</bibl>; also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 15</bibl>, the best MSS have colis; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">coles</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 2</bibl>; cf. cauliculus), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaulo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the stalk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stem of a plant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cepae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 21</bibl></cit> and 58: <cit><quote lang="la">fabarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 120</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dictamni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 413</bibl></cit>.—Of the vine, <hi rend="ital">the tendrils</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 7, 2</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">B</orth> <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a cabbage-stalk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cabbage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colewort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 62</bibl>; 2, 3, 125; Col 10, 369; 12, 7, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 240</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7180.1" n="II" level="1"> Of things of a similar form. </sense><sense id="n7180.2" n="A" level="2"> Pennae, <hi rend="ital">a quill</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 94, § 228</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7180.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The stem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bony part of an ox</hi>' <hi rend="ital">s tail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 50, 111, § 265</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7180.4" n="C" level="2"> In insects, <hi rend="ital">a tube by which eggs are deposited</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 101</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7180.5" n="D" level="2"> = membrum virile, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 399, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(coles),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 413</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caulodes: <entryFree id="n7181" type="greek" key="caulo_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caulōdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaulw/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n7181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stalk-like</hi>: brassica, a <hi rend="ital">kind of cabbage with large leaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caulonia: <entryFree id="n7182" type="main" key="Caulo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caulōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Caulon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 553</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 15, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 95</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Caulona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 705</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*kaulwni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city founded by the Achœans on the east coast of Bruttium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Castel Vetere</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:12:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 12, 6 sq.</bibl>; cf. Serv. ad Verg. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
cauma: <entryFree id="n7183" type="greek" key="cauma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cauma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kau=ma</foreign>, <sense id="n7183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the heat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 30, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caunus: <entryFree id="n7184" type="main" key="Caunus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caunus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kau=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n7184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town on the coast of Caria</hi>, now <cb n="CAUS" /> <hi rend="ital">Kaiguez</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 40, 84</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to the fable, built by Caunos, a son of Miletus, and brother of Byblis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 453</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7184.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence the <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n7184.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caunĕus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Caunus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Caunus.</hi>—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caunĕae</orth> (sc. ficus), <hi rend="ital">Caunian dried figs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 40, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 19, 21, § 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caunīs (for Cauneis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:414" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 414</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caunĕi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caunĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Caunus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 56, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:11:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 11, § 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7184.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caunītes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kauni/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Caunian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9</bibl></cit>. 45, § 99.</sense></entryFree>
caupo: <entryFree id="n7185" type="main" key="caupo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caupo</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōpo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūpo</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 47</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 6, 7</bibl>; <sense id="n7185.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">the form copo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 59, 163</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4169</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Momms.</author> 5078</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root cap-, to take in, receive, v. capio; cf. <foreign lang="greek">ka/phlos</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a petty tradesman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">huckster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innkeeper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 29</bibl> K. and H.; 1, 5, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:57" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:1 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 9, 1 al.</bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n7185.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae atque facundiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caupona: <entryFree id="n7186" type="main" key="caupo_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caupōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (upon the form cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 684</bibl> P.) [caupo]. <sense id="n7186.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A female shopkeeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">huckster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a landlady</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostess</hi> (anteand post-class.), Lucil. ap. Prisc. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 105, 23, p. 18</bibl> Bip.—</sense><sense id="n7186.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A retail shop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tavern</hi> (syn. taberna), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 47, 71, § 154</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauponam exercere,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep an inn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cauponaria: <entryFree id="n7187" type="gloss" key="caupo_na_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caupōnārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaphlikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n7187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female shopkeeper</hi>, Onom. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
cauponarius: <entryFree id="n7188" type="gloss" key="caupo_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caupōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/phlos</foreign>, <sense id="n7188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shopkeeper</hi>, Gloss. Cyr.</sense></entryFree>
cauponius: <entryFree id="n7189" type="main" key="caupo_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caupōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caupo</etym>, <sense id="n7189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a retail shopkeeper</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to an innkeeper</hi>: puer, <hi rend="ital">a shop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tavern boy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:43" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:13" default="NO">33, 7, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7189.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">caupōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">tavern furniture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 15</bibl> pr.</sense></entryFree>
cauponor: <entryFree id="n7190" type="main" key="caupo_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caupōnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to traffic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trade in</hi> any thing; trop.: bellum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 201 Vahl.); cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kaphleu/ein ma/xhn</foreign>, Aesch. Sept. 347: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum veritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 4, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cauponula: <entryFree id="n7191" type="main" key="caupo_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caupōnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>caupona, II.</etym>, <sense id="n7191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small inn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tavern</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl>; Schol. Bobiens. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:page=275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. p. 275</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
caupulus: <entryFree id="n7192" type="gloss" key="caupu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caupŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of small ship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1, 25</bibl>, where Lind. has caupilus.</sense></entryFree>
cauricrepus: <entryFree id="n7193" type="main" key="cauri_cre^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caurīcrĕpus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caurus-crepo</etym>, <sense id="n7193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blown through by the north-west wind</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> 869</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caurinus: <entryFree id="n7194" type="main" key="cauri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caurīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caurus</etym>, <sense id="n7194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the north-west wind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 296</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caurio: <entryFree id="n7195" type="hapax" key="cauri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caurĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n7195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the natural sound of the rutting panther</hi>, Auct. Philom. 50.</sense></entryFree>
caurus: <entryFree id="n7196" type="main" key="Caurus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caurus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. Goth. skūra, the north wind</etym>, <sense id="n7196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the north-west wind;</hi> form Caurus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 12</bibl> and 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 356</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form Corus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
causa: <entryFree id="n7197" type="main" key="causa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causa</orth> (by Cicero, and also a little after him, <orth extent="full" lang="la">caussa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 20</bibl>; so Fast. Praenest. pp. 321, 322; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3681</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4077</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4698 al.</bibl>; in Mon. Ancyr. 3, 1 dub.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. root cav- of caveo, prop. that which is defended or protected; cf. cura</etym>, <sense id="n7197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">through which any thing takes place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is done</hi>; <hi rend="ital">a cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">motive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inducement;</hi> also, in gen., <hi rend="ital">an occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunity</hi> (opp. effectis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:29" default="NO">7, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:36 al" default="NO">12, 1, 36 al.</bibl>; very freq. in all periods, and in all kinds of discourse. In its different meanings syn. with ratio, principium, fons, origo, caput; excusatio, defensio; judicium, controversia, lis; partes, actio; condicio, negotium, commodum, al.). </sense><sense id="n7197.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: causa ea est, quae id efficit, cujus est causa; ut vulnus mortis; cruditas morbi; <cit><quote lang="la">ignis ardoris. Itaque non sic causa intellegi debet, ut quod cuique antecedat, id ei causa sit, sed quod cuique efficienter antecedat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justa et magna et perspicua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sontica causa, v. sonticus.—Followed by a particle of cause: causa, quamobrem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 65</bibl>; id. <pb n="304" /> <cb n="CAUS" /> Heaut. 2, 3, 95; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:16:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 16, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa, quare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:20:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 20, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:11" default="NO">2, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 19 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:46:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 46, § 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:30 al" default="NO">5, 10, 30 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud causa quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae causa est quin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid causae est quin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:11:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 11, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla causa est quin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa quominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:56:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 56, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:39:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 39, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil causae est cur non, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae propter quas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:24" default="NO">5, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:23" default="NO">8, 6, 23</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is, qui causa mortis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:42" default="NO">7, 4, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 502</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 397</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos causa belli sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa mortis fuistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:27:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 27, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicandae philosophiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero umquam bellorum civilium semen et causa deerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 29</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 553</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix qui potuit rerum cognoscere causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera objurgandi causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 131</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa ad objurgandum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 71</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurgere in arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestare carinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 464</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum causā,</quote> <trans><tr>with good reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:8:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 8, § 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine causā,</quote> <trans><tr>without good reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 28, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:9" default="NO">1, 12, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">his de causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id nisi gravi de causā non fecisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justis de causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā de causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 41, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus de causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">less freq. in ante-Aug. prose: quā ex causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 17, 36</bibl>; but very freq. in Quint., Sen., and the younger Plin.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nullā aliā ex causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 29:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis ex causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ex causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 6, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex plurimis causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his (causis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 6</bibl></cit>:—ob eam causam scribo, ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa festinatio fuit ob illam causam, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:40:section=99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 40, § 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob eam causam, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob eas causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob eam ipsam causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam ob causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter eam quam dixi causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:46:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 46, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae propter quas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—In causā esse, <hi rend="ital">to be the cause of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">responsible for</hi>, etc. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in causā haec sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim morbi in causā esse, quo serius perficeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundiam multis in causā fuisse, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 49, § 94</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tarditatis causa in senatu fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 58, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7197.2" n="b" level="4"> Causā, in <case>abl.</case> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">possess. adj.</hi> (usu. put after the noun), as patris causā, meā causā, <hi rend="ital">on account of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the sake of</hi> (in the best prose, almost always referring to the future, and implying a purpose; cf. propter with <case>acc.</case> of the pre-existing cause or motive): <cit><quote lang="la">honoris tui causā huc ad te venimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:26:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 26, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi causa, v. animus, II., etc.: exempli causā, v. exemplum: causā meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:42 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 42 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 23 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">causā meāpte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrā magis hoc causā volebam quam meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35</bibl></cit>. 162: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena potius causa quam sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—Put before the noun: <cit><quote lang="la">rastros capsit causă potiendi agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:324" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 324</bibl></cit> Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid hujus feci, causā virginis Feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 122</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 32, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 14, 8</bibl>; 40, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 40, 44, 10.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">propter</hi> in the same sense: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrarum sedum templorumque causā, propter salutem meorum civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 20, 45</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. of pers.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reflex. pron.</hi> instead of <hi rend="ital">possess.</hi> very rare (v. Lahmeyer ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 57</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod illi semper sui causā fecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:52:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 52, § 121</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n7197.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n7197.4" n="A" level="2"> = justa causa, <hi rend="ital">good reason</hi>,<cb n="CAUS" />  <hi rend="ital">just cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full right</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum causā accedere ad accusandum,</quote> <trans><tr>with good reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:8:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 8, § 21</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 247</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:16:7" default="NO">3, 16, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and the contrary: sine causā,</quote> <trans><tr>without good reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 28, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 6:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 6, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7197.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An apology</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excuse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:219 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 219 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7197.6" n="C" level="2"> Causam alicui dare alicujus rei, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Nebatius) mihi dedit causam harum litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which poët.: Bacchus et ad culpam causas dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 455</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n7197.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A feigned cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pretext</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretence</hi>, = praetextus, <foreign lang="greek">pro/fasis</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingere falsas causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 3, 8</bibl> Ruhnk.; 4, 1, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingit causas ne det,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morae facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to pretend reasons for the delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferre causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam interponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Milt. 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ham. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:1:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 1, 4 al.</bibl></cit> (On the other hand, causa, <hi rend="ital">a true cause</hi>, is opp. to praetextus, <hi rend="ital">a pretext</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 30</bibl>.)—So freq. per causam, <hi rend="ital">under the pretext</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32, 1</bibl> Drak.; 22, 61, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:26" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:452" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 452</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7197.8" n="E" level="2"> In judic. lang. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judicial process</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lawsuit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:20:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 20, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 21, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis aut famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:55" default="NO">7, 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:30" default="NO">10, 7, 30</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 1, 67 et saep.: constituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perorare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:24" default="NO">12, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:37" default="NO">12, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere (= obticere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 190</bibl></cit>: causā cadere, v. cado, II.: causam dicere, <hi rend="ital">to defend one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to make a defence</hi> (as an advocate), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 12</bibl> and 13; 21, 54; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 8, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:24" default="NO">8, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 30</bibl> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: causa prior, <hi rend="ital">the first part of the process</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the trial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 37</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7197.9" n="2" level="3"> Out of the sphere of judicial proceedings, <hi rend="ital">the party</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause that one defends</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne condemnare causam illam, quam secutus esset, videretur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:9:27 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 9, 27 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suarum partium causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa Caesaris melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:36 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 36 al.</bibl> —Hence, </sense><sense id="n7197.10" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7197.11" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A relation of friendship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quīcum tibi adfininitas, societas, omnes denique causae et necessitudines veteres intercedebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicare breviter, quae mihi sit ratio et causa cum Caesare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 19, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7197.12" n="(b)" level="5"> In gen., = condicio, <hi rend="ital">a condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nonnumquam mortem sibi ipse consciscere aliquis debeat, alius in eādem causā non debeat: num enim aliā in causā M. Cato fuit, alia ceteri, qui se in Africā Caesari tradiderunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 112</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 4</bibl> Herz.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Regulus) erat in meliore causā quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:27:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 27, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 9</bibl> (where for causa in the foll. clause is condicio): <cit><quote lang="la">atque in hoc genere mea causa est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 13, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7197.13" n="(g)" level="5"> = negotium, <hi rend="ital">a cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">business undertaken for any one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an employment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui senatus dederat publice causam, ut mihi gratias ageret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:73:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 73, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nemo eorum rediisset, qui super tali causā eodem missi erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7197.14" n="F" level="1"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">a cause for disease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam metuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 15, 61, § 218</bibl>.—Hence in late Lat. for <hi rend="ital">disease</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:29:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 2, 29, 157</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 45, 5</bibl>; 4, 4, 2 al.—</sense><sense id="n7197.15" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which lies at the basis of a rhetorical representation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">u(po/qesis</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:21:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 21, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:7 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 7 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
causalis: <entryFree id="n7198" type="main" key="causa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>causa</etym> (rare and only late Lat.). <sense id="n7198.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">causal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gen. 7:23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Gen. 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Causālĭa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a work on the causes of things</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 163</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7198.1" n="II" level="1"> In gram.: conjunctiones. <hi rend="ital">which annex a reason for what precedes</hi> (e. g. nam, enim, itaque, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 199</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 410</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 16, p. 1027</bibl> ib. <cb n="CAUS" /> —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">causālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">causally</hi>, Aug. l. l. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 6, 5.</sense></entryFree>
causarie: <entryFree id="n7199" type="main" key="causa_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. causarius <sense id="n7199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
causarius: <entryFree id="n7200" type="main" key="causa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>causa, II. D.</etym>. <sense id="n7200.0" n="I" level="1"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">sick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diseased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">4: partes, quibus adhibenda curatio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 68:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 68, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 3, 37, § 75</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causarii vel latere vel faucibus,</quote> <trans><tr>sick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 25, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7200.1" n="II" level="1"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">discharged on account of ill health</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invalid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 6, 14</bibl>.—Hence, missio, <hi rend="ital">a discharge from military service on account of sickness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a liberation from service</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:26" default="NO">29, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:13" default="NO">49, 16, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 144, 16</bibl>.— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">causārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">on account of sickness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui causarie missus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:13:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 13, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
causate: <entryFree id="n7201" type="hapax" key="causa_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>from an unused <pos>adj.</pos> causatus, from causa</etym>, <sense id="n7201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with good reason</hi>: causatius, Plin. praef. § 8.</sense></entryFree>
causatio: <entryFree id="n7202" type="main" key="causa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>causa, II. C.</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n7202.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pretext</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an excuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apology</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plea</hi>, Cod. Th. 3, 5, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Marc. 5, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegri corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:30" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7202.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rara,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
causativus: <entryFree id="n7203" type="main" key="causa_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>causa</etym>. <sense id="n7203.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Causative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 731</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7203.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a lawsuit; subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causativum litis,</quote> <trans><tr>the matter in dispute</tr>, <tr>the gist of the action</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 472</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fortun.</author> Art. Rhet. 1, 2</bibl>; Jul. Vict. Art. Rhet. 1, 2; 3, 8.—</sense><sense id="n7203.2" n="III" level="1"> In gram.: causativus casus = accusativus, <hi rend="ital">the accusative</hi>, i. e. the arraigning case, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 671</bibl> P.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">persona,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the first person</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 821</bibl></cit> ib.</sense></entryFree>
causia: <entryFree id="n7204" type="greek" key="causi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kausi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Macedonian white hat with a broad brim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worn in Rome by the poorer people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a protection against the sun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:29" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 29</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7204.1" n="II" level="1"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a kind of roof for the protection of besiegers</hi>, = vinea, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
causidicalis: <entryFree id="n7205" type="hapax" key="causi^di^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causĭdĭcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>causidicus</etym>, <sense id="n7205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to an advocate</hi>: odium et taedium, M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
causidicatio: <entryFree id="n7206" type="hapax" key="causi^di^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causĭdĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the speech of an advocate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Anton. 2, p. 298" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Anton. 2, p. 298</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
causidicatus: <entryFree id="n7207" type="gloss" key="causi^di^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causĭdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forensic oratory</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">dikologi/a</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
causidicina: <entryFree id="n7208" type="main" key="causi^di^ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causĭdĭcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>causidicus</etym>, <sense id="n7208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of advocate</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">id habet causidicina cum ceteris metuendum, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:75" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 75</bibl>; Cod. Th. 8, 4, 30 al.</sense></entryFree>
causidicus: <entryFree id="n7209" type="main" key="causi^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causĭdĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">causs-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>causadico</etym>, <sense id="n7209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pleader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advocate</hi> (in a contemptuous sense in distinction from <hi rend="ital">orator;</hi> cf. Burm. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46, 7</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">in somnis videmur ... Causidici causas agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:966" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 966</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litium advocatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 25</bibl></cit> Spald.; <cit><quote lang="la">connected with proclamator and rabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 1 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with praeco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:439" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 439</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 305, 20</bibl>; Cod. Th. 2, 10, 1 sqq.</sense></entryFree>
