causificor: <entryFree id="n7210" type="main" key="causi^fi^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causĭfĭcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>causa-facio</etym>, <sense id="n7210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to allege a cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a pretext</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pretence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pretend</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">haut causificor quin eam Ego habeam,</quote> <trans><tr>I offer no pretext against keeping her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blaterans atque causificans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 242</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
causor: <entryFree id="n7211" type="main" key="causor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">causs-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n7211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trans.</hi> [causa]. </sense><sense id="n7211.1" n="I" level="1"> In the ante-class. per., <hi rend="ital">to plead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispute concerning a subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to discuss it for and against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to debate a question</hi>, Pac., Att., and Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 89, 11 sq.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n7211.2" n="II" level="1"> Since the Aug. per. (in Ciceronian Lat. the word is not used), <hi rend="ital">to give as a reason</hi> (a real, and more freq. a feigned one) <hi rend="ital">for something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a pretext of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pretend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plead.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7211.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves aut omina dira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:17 sq" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 17 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omina Visaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 768</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec freta pressurus tumidos causabitur Euros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: stultus uterque locum immeritum causatur inique: in culpā est animus. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse valetudinem excusans, patre animi quoque ejus haud mirabilem interturbationem causante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:64:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 64, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 10, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversam patris voluntatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:18 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 18 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n7211.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">causando nostros in longum ducis amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7211.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> <pb n="305" /> <cb n="CAUT" /> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 9</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7211.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causatus in utroque, quod hic non esset secutus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 3</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causari accipere rationes,</quote> <trans><tr>to avoid by a pretence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:34:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 7, 34, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caussa: <entryFree id="n7212" type="main" key="caussa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caussa, caussālis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">caussārĭus</orth>, etc., v. causa, etc.</entryFree>
caustice: <entryFree id="n7213" type="greek" key="causti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caustĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaustikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n7213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a caustic plant</hi>, called scelerata in pure Lat., <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
causticus: <entryFree id="n7214" type="greek" key="causti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caustĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kaustiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrosive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 54, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 10, 52, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spuma,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of soap with which the Germans colored their hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:26:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 26, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">caustĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. medicamentum), <hi rend="ital">a burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corroding medicament</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 3, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:65" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 39, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:178" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 18, 56, § 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
causula: <entryFree id="n7215" type="main" key="causu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">causŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>causa</etym>. <sense id="n7215.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A petty lawsuit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Macrin. 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7215.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slight occasion</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 54.</sense></entryFree>
caute: <entryFree id="n7216" type="main" key="caute_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. caveo, <sense id="n7216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cautela: <entryFree id="n7217" type="main" key="caute_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cautus, caveo</etym> (mostly post - class.), <sense id="n7217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">caution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precaution.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7217.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si minus cum curā aut cautelā locus loquendi lectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit> dub. (bracketed by Brix); <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>, p. 160, 36.—</sense><sense id="n7217.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in the jurists, = cautio, <hi rend="ital">a surety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:6" default="NO">13, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:14" default="NO">16, 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cauter: <entryFree id="n7218" type="greek" key="caute_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautēr</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kauth/r</foreign> (accessory form to cauterium, and only post-class.). <sense id="n7218.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A branding-iron</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 41, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 43, 3</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 490.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauterem adigere ambitioni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7218.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wound made by burning</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 229.</sense></entryFree>
cauterio: <entryFree id="n7219" type="main" key="caute_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautērĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cauterium</etym>, <sense id="n7219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burn</hi>, and trop., <hi rend="ital">to mark with a branding-iron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to brand</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> ad Tim. 1, 4, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cauterium: <entryFree id="n7220" type="greek" key="caute_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kauth/sion</foreign>. <sense id="n7220.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An instrument used for branding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a branding-iron</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in medicine,</quote> <trans><tr>a cautery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 39, § 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:102" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 23, 49, § 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 240" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 240</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7220.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An instrument used in encaustic painting for burning in the wax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cauterizo: <entryFree id="n7221" type="greek" key="caute_ri_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautērīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kauthsia/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n7221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burn with a hot iron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to brand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cauteroma: <entryFree id="n7222" type="hapax" key="caute_ro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautērōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cauter</etym>, <sense id="n7222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 3, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cautes: <entryFree id="n7223" type="main" key="caute_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautēs</orth> (e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cautĭs</orth>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 701), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with cōs, cōtis; Sanscr. s)ō, acuere, Bopp, Gloss. 353, 6</etym>, <sense id="n7223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pointed rock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa et cautes timere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:402" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 402</bibl></cit> Vahl. ex conj.: <cit><quote lang="la">durae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 366</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 672</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 418</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praerupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:719" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>. —As a symbol of insensibility, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 330</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cautim: <entryFree id="n7224" type="main" key="cautim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>cautus, caveo</etym>, <sense id="n7224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cautiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warily</hi>, = caute, perh. only <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 512, 11</bibl> and 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 8, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cautio: <entryFree id="n7225" type="main" key="cauti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautĭo</orth> (old uncontr. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cauĭtĭo</orth>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=61" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 61</bibl> Müll.), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>caveo</etym>, <sense id="n7225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a guarding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taking care of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wariness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precaution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumspection</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">eu)la/beia</foreign> (besides the comic poets, mostly in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n7225.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: a malis natură declinamus: quae declinatio, si cum ratione fiet, cautio appelletur; <cit><quote lang="la">quae autem sine ratione, nominetur metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautio et timiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:74:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 74, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium horum vitiorum atque incommodorum una cautio est atque una provisio, ut ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautio ac diligentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">initium suspitionis et cautionis et diligentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7225.2" n="b" level="4"> (Mihi) cautio est = cavendum est, <hi rend="ital">caution is necessary</hi> (a colloquial phrase), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea cautio est,</quote> <trans><tr>I must see to it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit> (al. captio).—</sense><sense id="n7225.3" n="c" level="4"> Res cautionem habet. </sense><sense id="n7225.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The matter requires caution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet multas cautiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 14, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7225.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The matter admits of caution</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7225.6" n="II" level="1"> T. t., in law, <hi rend="ital">that by which one places himself or another in safety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an obligation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warranty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Uail</hi> (<hi rend="ital">written or oral</hi>): quoniam vestrae cautiones infirmae sunt, Graeculam tibi misi cautionem chirographi<cb n="CAVE" />  mei, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 1</bibl>; v. such a written bond in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:40" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolatis cautionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:7:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:8:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offerre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4:50" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 44, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautionem praebere alicui indemnitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:30" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 5, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Of an oral warranty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pledge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 7, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cautionalis: <entryFree id="n7226" type="hapax" key="cauti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cautio, II.</etym>, <sense id="n7226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to security</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:5:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 5, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cautor: <entryFree id="n7227" type="main" key="cautor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>caveo</etym>. * <sense id="n7227.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who is on his guard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is wary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7227.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who is surety</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bail for any one</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 7, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cautroma: <entryFree id="n7228" type="main" key="cautro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautrōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cauter</etym>, <sense id="n7228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wound made by branding</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 3, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cautulus: <entryFree id="n7229" type="hapax" key="cautu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n7229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [cautus], <hi rend="ital">rather safe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:30" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cautus: <entryFree id="n7230" type="main" key="cautus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cautus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>caveo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
cavaedium: <entryFree id="n7231" type="main" key="ca^vaedi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvaedĭum</orth>, v. cavus, I. B.</entryFree>
cavamen: <entryFree id="n7232" type="main" key="ca^va_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cavo</etym>. <sense id="n7232.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hollowing out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7232.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cavern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hollow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 9, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cavannus: <entryFree id="n7233" type="main" key="ca^vannus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvannus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kikka/bh</foreign>, <sense id="n7233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the nightowl</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 5, 134, 29</bibl> Burm.</sense></entryFree>
cavarinus: <entryFree id="n7234" type="main" key="Cavari_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cavarīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Senone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made king of the Senones by Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cavaticus: <entryFree id="n7235" type="main" key="ca^va_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cavus</etym>, <sense id="n7235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born</hi> or <hi rend="ital">living in caves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 39, 59, § 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:45" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 6, 15, § 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cavatio: <entryFree id="n7236" type="main" key="ca^va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cavo</etym>, <sense id="n7236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cavern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hollow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5</bibl>, §§ 19 and 123 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 700</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cavator: <entryFree id="n7237" type="main" key="ca^va_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who hollows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">excavales</hi>: CABATORES (<hi rend="ital">hollowing workmen</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum (aves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 18, 20, § 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cavatura: <entryFree id="n7238" type="main" key="ca^va_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavity</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cavatus: <entryFree id="n7239" type="main" key="ca^va_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>cavo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
cavea: <entryFree id="n7240" type="main" key="ca^ve^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n7240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> caveāï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 78</bibl>) [cavus]. <hi rend="ital">an excavated place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7240.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 2, 2, § 3</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7240.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n7240.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An enclosure for animals</hi> (cf. caulae), <hi rend="ital">a stall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">den</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beehive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bird-cage</hi>, and the like, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:684" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 684</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 473</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:58:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 58, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:89:4" default="NO">9, 89, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 29 al.</bibl>—Of <hi rend="ital">a birdcage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 1, 79</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:35:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 35, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:77" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 77</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a beehive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:7" default="NO">9, 15, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:9" default="NO">9, 15, 9</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n7240.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An enclosure about a young tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in order to protect it from injury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:11" default="NO">5, 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 10, 5</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a hedge before the windows of a cage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7240.5" n="C" level="2"> In the human body. </sense><sense id="n7240.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The roof of the mouth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 2, 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7240.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The sockets of the eyes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 40, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7240.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The part of the theatre in which spectators sat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spectators</hi>' <hi rend="ital">seats</hi> or <hi rend="ital">benches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 340</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 636</bibl>; on account of the ascending rows of benches, ima or prima, <hi rend="ital">the seat of the nobility</hi>, media and summa or ultima, <hi rend="ital">the seat of the lower classes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">CAV. II.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2539</bibl></cit>; cf. Dict. of Antiq.—</sense><sense id="n7240.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7240.10" n="a" level="4"> (Pars pro toto.) <hi rend="ital">The theatre</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 1</bibl>. 39; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7240.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The spectators</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:423" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 423</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cavealis: <entryFree id="n7241" type="main" key="ca^ve^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvĕālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cavea</etym>, <sense id="n7241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kept in a cave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cellar</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 53, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 14, 1</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
caveatus: <entryFree id="n7242" type="main" key="ca^ve^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> (Plinian). <sense id="n7242.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Encaged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cooped up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 13</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7242.1" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to cavea, II D.) <hi rend="ital">Arranged like the</hi> cavea <hi rend="ital">in a theatre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cavefacio: <entryFree id="n7243" type="main" key="ca^ve^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>cĕre</itype>, = caveo, Ven. Carm. 8, 6, 192.—Hence, in <sense id="n7243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">CAVIFIERI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3678</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caveo: <entryFree id="n7244" type="main" key="ca^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvĕo</orth>, <itype>cāvi, cautum</itype>, (2<sense id="n7244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">d pers. sing.</hi> scanned cavĕs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 19</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> cavĕ, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 13</bibl> et saep.: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:50:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 50, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 25</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 435; old <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> CAVĬTVM, C. I. L. 1, 200, 6 sq.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [root SKOF- or KOF-, to be wary; whence Gr. <foreign lang="greek">quosko/os, a)kou/w</foreign>, etc.; Lat. causa, cura; cf. also Germ. scheuen; Engl. shy], <hi rend="ital">to be on one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s guard</hi>, either for one's self or (more rarely) for <cb n="CAVE" /> another; hence, </sense><sense id="n7244.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., with and without sibi, <hi rend="ital">to be on one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take heed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beware</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avoid</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">fula/ssomai</foreign>, and the Fr. se garder, prendre garde, etc.; constr., <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ub</hi>, and in a course of action with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (also ellipt. with the simple subj.); or, as in Greek, with <case>acc.</case> (= <foreign lang="greek">fula/ssomai/ ti</foreign>); hence also <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> and with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, and once with <hi rend="ital">cum.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7244.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui consulte, docte, atque astute cavet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciet, nisi caveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego cavebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erunt (molesti) nisi cavetis. Cautum est, inquit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum animum attendisset ad cavendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metues, doctusque cavebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 68</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. in the warning cave, <hi rend="ital">look out! be careful!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 89</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.3" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo mi abs te caveo cautius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si abs te modo uno caveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi ab eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis Aps quă cavendum nobis sane censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater a me petiit Ut mihi caverem a Pseudolo servo suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a crasso infortunio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille Pompeium monebat, ut meam domum metueret, atque a me ipso caveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 64, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caveo ab homine impuro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Cassio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 108:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 108, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monitum ut sibi ab insidiis Rufini caveret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 87, p. 329, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.4" n="2" level="3"> With the simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">caveo malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infortunio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsus sibi cavit loco,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>got out of the way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Hercle, mihi tecum cavendum est,</quote> <trans><tr>with you</tr>, <tr>I must look out for myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.6" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 20</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7244.7" n="C" level="2"> Followed by a final clause. </sense><sense id="n7244.8" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take heed that... not</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be on one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s guard lest</hi>: qui cavet ne decipiatur, vix cavet; <cit><quote lang="la">cum etiam cavet, etiam cum cavisse ratus est, saepe is cautor captus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit> and 6: <cit><quote lang="la">caves, ne videat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me scio cavisse, ne ulla merito contumelia Fieri a nobis posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 111, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavete, judices, ne nova ... proscriptio instaurata esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:53:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 53, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 40, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave, ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 152</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 685</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave sis, ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caveto ne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caveas, ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caveant, ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavendum est, ne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:2" default="NO">12, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:27" default="NO">5, 11, 27</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7244.9" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut ne</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quod ut ne accidat cavendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.10" n="3" level="3"> With a simple <hi rend="ital">subj.;</hi> so only <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>: cave or cavete (cf. age), <hi rend="ital">beware of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take care not</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cave geras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faxis cave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contingas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">despuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:50:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 50, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoscas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 12, 1</bibl></cit> al.—Rarely with 1<hi rend="ital">st pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave posthac, si me amas, umquam istuc verbum ex te audiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 9</bibl>.—With 3<hi rend="ital">d pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">resciscat quisquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te fratrum misereatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">roget te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave quisquam flocci fecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis concurrant arma cavete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 293</bibl></cit>.—And like age, cave with a <hi rend="ital">verb</hi> in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave dirumpatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.11" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take care that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauto opu'st, Ut sobrie hoc agatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">D. 2, infra: tertium est, ut caveamus, ut ea, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaero quid sit, quod... tam accurate caveat et sanciat, ut heredes sui dent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caverat sibi ille adulter omnium ut suorum scelerum socium te adjutoremque praebeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 12, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:39:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 39, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavebitur ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. under II. A.—Very rarely with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> omitted, <hi rend="ital">take care to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be sure to</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sed heus tu... cave regrediare cenā maturius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>, p. 124, <pb n="306" /> <cb n="CAVE" /> 35.—</sense><sense id="n7244.12" n="D" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7244.13" n="1" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> of <hi rend="ital">pers.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi> against which warning is given or beed taken, <hi rend="ital">to guard against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be aware of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beware of</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto quid nunc primum caveam, nescio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, quod cavere possis, stultum admittere'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 437, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caveamus fulminis ictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 406</bibl></cit>: cave canem, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 153, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4320</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. canis: interventum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum caecum fossasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam sit bellum cavere malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim atque opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">male praecinctum puerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:456" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc tu caveto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proditorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc caverat mens provida Reguli,</quote> <trans><tr>had prevented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave quicquam,</quote> <trans><tr>be a little careful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: quid cavendum tibi censere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 437, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavenda est etiam gloriae cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera, quae quidem consilio provideri poterunt, cavebuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:143" default="NO">9, 4, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:27" default="NO">11, 3, 27</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 2</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc pestifero bello cavendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod multis rationibus caveri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 24, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 67:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 67, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius quod cautum oportuit, Postquam comedit rem, post rationem putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tibi cautum volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis cautum tibi ad defensionem fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:35:section=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 35, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid quisque vitet, nunquam homini satis Cautum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id modo simul orant ac monent, ut ipsis ab invidiā caveatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 52, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">B. 1. supra: cauto opus est,</quote> <trans><tr>care must be taken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 133</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.15" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus cave vereri ( = noli),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caveret id petere a populo Romano, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caveto laedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:50:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 50, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occursare capro caveto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commisisse cavet, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave Spem festinando praecipitare meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:139" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pedes omnino caveant tinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 68, § 169</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n7244.16" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n7244.17" n="A" level="2"> Law t. t., <hi rend="ital">to take care for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order something</hi>, legally, or (of private relations) <hi rend="ital">to order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispose of in writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stipulate</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ita caverent, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:11:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 11, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae sunt praeterea leges de sepulcris, quarum altera privatorum aedificiis, altera ipsis sepulcris cavet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautum est in Scipionis legibus ne plures essent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautum est lege XII. Tab., ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 5, 6, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavebatur ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae legibus cauta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliā in lege cautum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:41:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 41, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautum est de numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredi caveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:41:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 41, 120</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc, qui testamentum faciebat, cavere noluisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamento cavere ut dies natalis ageretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 103</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi se privatim nihil cavere... militibus cavendum, quod apud patres semel plebi, iterum legionibus cautum sit ne fraudi secessio esset,</quote> <trans><tr>to make conditions</tr>, <tr>stipulate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 41, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.18" n="B" level="2"> In the lang. of business. </sense><sense id="n7244.19" n="1" level="3"> Cavere ab aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to make one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self secure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to procure bail</hi> or <hi rend="ital">surety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi ego, Brute, non solvam, nisi prius a te cavero, amplius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:23:section=55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 23, § 55</bibl>; cf. infra 2.; and cautio, II.—So <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ita Flavio sibi cavere non venit in mentem,</quote> <trans><tr>to take security</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.20" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make one secure by bail</hi> or <hi rend="ital">surety</hi> (either written or oral), <hi rend="ital">to give security</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to guarantee</hi> (cf. supra 1., and cautio; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: spondeo, cautionem praesto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 59, 162</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia, quam mihi Stichus Titii servus caverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:89" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavere summam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:97" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 2, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chirographum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:89" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:8:6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates obsidibus de pecuniā cavent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam de obsidibus inter se cavere non possent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavere capite pro re aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 17, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurejurando et chirographo de eā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavere in duplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 41</bibl></cit>; <cb n="CAVE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 17</bibl>.—Rarely, cavere personae publicae, <hi rend="ital">to give security before a public authority</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 11, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.21" n="C" level="2"> In boxing, etc., <hi rend="ital">to parry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ward off a blow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversos ictus cavere ac propulsare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:54" default="NO">5, 13, 54</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:26" default="NO">4, 2, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.22" n="D" level="2"> Cavere alicui. </sense><sense id="n7244.23" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To keep something from one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have a care for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take care of</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prohibeo, defendo, provideo): scabiem pecori et jumentis caveto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius ei cavere volo, quam ipse aliis solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi meisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterani, quibus hic ordo diligentissime caverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: qui in Oratore tuo caves tibi per Brutum, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quique aliis cavit, non cavet ipsi sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordiae publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:48:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 48, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:493" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 493</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7244.24" n="2" level="3"> Affirmatively, <hi rend="ital">to take care for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend to</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">for</hi> a person, <hi rend="ital">provide: Ba.</hi> Haec ita me orat sibi qui caveat aliquem ut hominem reperiam... Id, amabo te, huic caveas. <hi rend="ital">Pi.</hi> Quid isti caveam? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 10</bibl>; cf. I. C. 3. supra.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cautus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n7244.25" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cautious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provident</hi> (syn.: providus, prudens; <cit><quote lang="la">class. in prose and poetry): ut cautus est, ubi nihil opu'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum cauti providique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauti in periculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scribendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in credendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in verbis serendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mariti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:751" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 751</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulpes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem certi homines monuerunt, ut cautior esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubium cautior an audentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 58</bibl></cit>.—Constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad praesentius malum cautiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 32, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:46" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 20</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum cautus adversus colloquii fraudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 25, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">erga</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erga bona sua satis cautus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:40" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra quam (fortunam) non satis cauta mortalitas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautum dignos assumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 51</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei divinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.26" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautissima senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 5, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:336" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:188" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:65" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 65</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cauta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <trans><tr>the provisions</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.27" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> (acc. to I. B. 1., and II. B.), <hi rend="ital">made safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secured</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautos nominibus rectis expendere nummos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautus ab incursu belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 409</bibl></cit>: quo mulieri esset res cautior (<hi rend="ital">that her property might be made more secure</hi>), curavit, ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 4, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.28" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">in eam partem peccare, quae est cautior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(civitates) murorum firmitate cautissimae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cau-tē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n7244.29" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to caveo, I. A.) <hi rend="ital">Cautiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caute et cogitate rem tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedetentimque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:42:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 42, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et cum judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 3</bibl></cit> et saep. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:76" default="NO">9, 2, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 10 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 26, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7244.30" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to caveo, I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">With security</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cautiously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter nec caute nec jure fieri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caverna: <entryFree id="n7245" type="main" key="ca^verna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căverna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cavus</etym>, <sense id="n7245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grotto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hole</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caverna terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 597</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 60, 151</bibl>: silicum, <hi rend="ital">rocky vaults</hi> (of the interior of Aetna), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 683</bibl>, for which curvae cavernae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 674</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 502</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 698</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:639" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 639</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 299: navium,</quote> <trans><tr>the holds of ships</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 180</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurium loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 50, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasorum fictilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 3, 7, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arboris,</quote> <trans><tr>clefts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:16:3 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 16, 3 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <trans><tr>the vault of heaven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:252" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=253" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 253</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetheriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 391</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">aëris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 202</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">the excrementary canal of animals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 218</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:106" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 27, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:137" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 15, 47, § 137</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, utraque (mulieris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 71, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cavernatim: <entryFree id="n7246" type="hapax" key="ca^verna_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvernātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>caverna</etym>, <sense id="n7246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">through caverns</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua eructata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caverno: <entryFree id="n7247" type="hapax" key="ca^verno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căverno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make hollow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:26" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cavernosus: <entryFree id="n7248" type="main" key="ca^verno_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvernōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of hollows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cavities</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 37</bibl></cit>, <cb n="CAVO" /> § 58; 27, 5, 17, § 34: meatus vocis, Prua Ham. 319.</sense></entryFree>
cavernula: <entryFree id="n7249" type="hapax" key="ca^vernu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvernŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>caverna</etym>, <sense id="n7249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small cavity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 74, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
