caviares: <entryFree id="n7250" type="gloss" key="ca^vi^a_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvĭāres hostiae</orth>, <sense id="n7250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">victims</hi>, so called from caviae, the excrementary canal of animals, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=57" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 57</bibl> Müll. [caviae = cavernae; v. caverna <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>].</sense></entryFree>
cavii: <entryFree id="n7251" type="main" key="Cavi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cavĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Grecian Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 30, 7</bibl> and 9.</sense></entryFree>
cavile: <entryFree id="n7252" type="main" key="ca^vi_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvīle</orth>, v. caulae.</entryFree>
cavilla: <entryFree id="n7253" type="main" key="ca^villa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>perh. for calvilla, from calvor; but cf. Sanscr. kava, stingy</etym>, <sense id="n7253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jeering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raillery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoffing</hi> (ante- and postclass., and very rare): aufer cavillam: non ego nunc nugas ago, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 423</bibl>.—Access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">căvil-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 9" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 9</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
cavillabundus: <entryFree id="n7254" type="hapax" key="ca^villa_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvillābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cavillor</etym>, <sense id="n7254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seeking for raillery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoffing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
cavillatio: <entryFree id="n7255" type="main" key="ca^villa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvillātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jeering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raillery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoffing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irony</hi> in jest or in earnest: <cit><quote lang="la">cum duo genera sint facetiarum, alterum aequabiliter in omni sermone fusum, alterum peracutum et breve: illa a veteribus superior cavillatio, haec altera dicacitas nominata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 218</bibl></cit>: cavillatio est jocosa calumniatio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=45" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 45</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter consules magis cavillatio quam magna contentio de provinciā fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n7255.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sophistical discourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sophistry</hi> (so most freq. in Quint.), Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 111:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 111, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:177" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 177</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ineptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manifesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine metu cavillationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cavillator: <entryFree id="n7256" type="main" key="ca^villa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvillātor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caulāt-</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 13</bibl>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jester</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jeerer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caviller</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7256.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sophist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 102:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 102, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cavillatrix: <entryFree id="n7257" type="main" key="ca^villa_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvillātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cavillator, II.</etym> (only twice in Quint.), <sense id="n7257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who seeks to take by sophistry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclusio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; hence also <hi rend="ital">sophistry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cavillatus: <entryFree id="n7258" type="hapax" key="ca^villa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvillātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cavillor</etym>, <sense id="n7258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">raillery</hi>, = cavillatio, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 213</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cavillor: <entryFree id="n7259" type="main" key="ca^villor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvillor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n7259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cavilla], <hi rend="ital">to practise jeering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mocking;</hi> or (<hi rend="ital">act.</hi>) <hi rend="ital">to censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">criticise; to satirize</hi> in jest or earnest, <hi rend="ital">to jest</hi>, etc. (syn.: jocari, ludere, illudere). </sense><sense id="n7259.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiariter cum ipso etiam cavillor ac jocor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:42:9" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 42, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facetissime apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7259.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam ejus praetextam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10</bibl></cit> (12), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc artem ut tenuem ac jejunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba patrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunos plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 58, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 15, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, cavillatus in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7259.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">objective clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo et etiam cavillatus est, aestate grave esse aureum amiculum, hieme frigidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n7259.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to reason captiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to use sophisms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to quibble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 267</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:85" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10, 36, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cavillosus: <entryFree id="n7260" type="hapax" key="ca^villo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvillōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cavillor</etym>, <sense id="n7260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of raillery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irony</hi>, Firm. Math. 5, 8.</sense></entryFree>
cavillum: <entryFree id="n7261" type="main" key="ca^villum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. cavilla <sense id="n7261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cavo: <entryFree id="n7262" type="main" key="ca^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cavus</etym>, <sense id="n7262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hollow out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excavate</hi> (class., but not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">for in Leg. 2, 18, 45, dicato is the correct reading, B. and K.): stillicidi casus lapidem cavat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 313</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 525</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves ex arboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbore lintres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buxum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes cavantur tabe pituitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna cavans cornua (in waning),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 17, 23, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parmam galeamque gladio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to pierce through</tr>, <tr>perforate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 130</bibl></cit>: tegmina tuta cavant capitum, <hi rend="ital">hollow out</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">round off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bend around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabricate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 632</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">căvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">hollowed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excavated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hollow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cortices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 229</bibl></cit>: anfracta aurium, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 193, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1194</bibl></cit> (with cava tempora): <cit><quote lang="la">vallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 20</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">torrens alibi aliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 35, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus cavatior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 29</bibl></cit>. <pb n="307" /> <cb n="CEBR" /></sense></entryFree>
cavositas: <entryFree id="n7263" type="main" key="ca^vo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cavosus, from cavus</etym>, <sense id="n7263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavity</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 55</bibl>, and Pudic. 20.</sense></entryFree>
cavum: <entryFree id="n7264" type="main" key="ca^vum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. cavus, I. B.</entryFree>
cavus: <entryFree id="n7265" type="main" key="ca^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">ku-, kue/w</foreign>, to swell, etc.; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">koi=los, keno/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n7265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excavated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concave</hi> (opp. plenus, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round;</hi> class.). </sense><sense id="n7265.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">cava conveniant plenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1085" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1085</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 620</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 464</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 335</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ungula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:419" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 419</bibl></cit> Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">fornaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:7:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 7, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:955" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 955</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:420" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 420</bibl></cit> Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">cavernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 191</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">trunci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 13, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vena,</quote> <trans><tr>the hollow vein</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:176" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:272" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 516</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 810 al.</bibl>—Hence also of a darkness enveloping one as a cloud: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 360</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <trans><tr>the deepchannelled mountain streams</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 326</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 427</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 396</bibl>: luna, <hi rend="ital">waning</hi> (cf. cavo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 54, 80, § 215</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7265.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">căvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">căvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. locus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:15:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 8</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hole</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1382</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 79, 81, § 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:266" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 51, 112, § 266</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cava caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:131" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. 131</bibl></cit> Vahl.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cava caerula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 332</bibl></cit> Vahl.; hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">căvum aedĭum</orth> (contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">căvae-dĭum</orth>, Phn. Ep. 2, 17, 5), <hi rend="ital">the inner court of Roman houses</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3</bibl> Schneid.; <cit><quote lang="la">O. Müll. Etrusk. 1, p. 255, and Archaeol. § 293, III.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=161" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3</bibl>; Dict. of Antiq.—</sense><sense id="n7265.3" n="II" level="1"> In late Lat., trop.: menses, <hi rend="ital">which have only</hi> 30 <hi rend="ital">days</hi> (opp. menses pleni, which have 31 days), <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7265.4" n="b" level="4"> = inanis, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 22, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 912</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caycus: <entryFree id="n7266" type="main" key="Ca^y_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căȳcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Caicus.</entryFree>
caystros: <entryFree id="n7267" type="main" key="Ca^ystro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căystrŏs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/u+stros</foreign>, <sense id="n7267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Lydia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which rises in Mount Tmolus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and falls into the sea at Ephesus</hi>, celebrated for the great number of its swans, now <hi rend="ital">Kara - Su</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caystros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 386</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caystrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 384</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 22, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 253</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 115</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căy-strĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Caystros</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales = cygnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ce: <entryFree id="n7268" type="main" key="ce^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">-cĕ</orth>, <itype>an inseparable strengthening demonstrative particle</itype>, answering etymol. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ge/</foreign> (Sanscr. ki; cf. Lat. ci-s and citra), and in signif. to the demonstr. <foreign lang="greek">i</foreign> (in <foreign lang="greek">ou(tosi/, touti/</foreign>, etc.), appended to words in different forms. <sense id="n7268.0" n="I" level="1"> Unchanged <hi rend="ital">ce</hi>: hicce, haecce, hocce; also in MSS. and inscriptions one <hi rend="ital">c</hi>: hice, etc.; <number>plur.</number>: hice, haece, haecce; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> hujusce, etc.—</sense><sense id="n7268.1" n="II" level="1"> Changed, </sense><sense id="n7268.2" n="A" level="2"> Into <hi rend="ital">ci</hi> before the interrog. particle <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: hiccine, hoccine, siccine, nunccine, etc. (v. hic, sic, nunc, etc.).—</sense><sense id="n7268.3" n="B" level="2"> By a rejection of <hi rend="ital">e</hi>, in hic, haec, hoc, nunc, etc. for hice, haece, hoce, nunce, etc.; illic, istic, nunc, sic (for illice, etc.); cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 132; Corss. Ausspr II. p. 235.</sense></entryFree>
cea: <entryFree id="n7269" type="main" key="Ce_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n7269.0" n="I" level="1"> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*ke/ws (*ki)a</foreign>, Ptol.), the Lat. name of the Greek Ceos (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 62</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">one of the most important of the Cyclades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over against the promontory Sunium</hi>, the birthplace of the poet Simonides, also celebrated for its splendid female clothing, now <hi rend="ital">Zia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 62</bibl>; Varr. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 222</bibl> Heins.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 368</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 2, 4</bibl>; <case>nom.</case> Ceos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 62</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Ceo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 22, § 65</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Ceo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 12, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7269.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēus</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cīus</orth>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 269</bibl> Lachm.), a, um, <hi rend="ital">of Cea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Simonides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 351</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—And with reference to the same: <cit><quote lang="la">Camenae,</quote> <trans><tr>his poems</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naeniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēï</orth>;,  <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Ceos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7269.2" n="II" level="1"> = Cos, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
cebenna: <entryFree id="n7270" type="main" key="Ce^benna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕbenna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕbenna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Cevenna.</entryFree>
cebren: <entryFree id="n7271" type="main" key="Ce_^bre_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cē^brēn</orth>, <itype>ēnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kebrh/n</foreign>, <sense id="n7271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Troas;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a river god</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Œnone</hi>, Sabin. Ep. 89, <hi rend="ital">and of Hesperie</hi>, who is thence called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cē^brēnis</orth>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Cebrenĭdos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:21" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 21</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Cebrenida, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 769</bibl>. <cb n="CEDO" /></sense></entryFree>
cecaumena: <entryFree id="n7272" type="greek" key="Ce^caume^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕcaumĕna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kekaume/na</foreign>, prop., <sense id="n7272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the burnt regions</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the torrid zone</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cecrops: <entryFree id="n7273" type="main" key="Ce_crops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēcrops</orth>, <itype>ŏpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ke/kroy</foreign>, <sense id="n7273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the most ancient king of Attica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who went there from the Egyptian Sais</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was founder of the citadel of Athens</hi> (which is hence called Cecropia; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 48" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 48</bibl> and 158; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:25:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 25, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 194</bibl>; acc. to the fable, half man and half serpent; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, geminus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 555</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7273.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n7273.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēcrŏpĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n7273.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Cecrops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cecropian;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēcrŏpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the citadel of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built by Cecrops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 194</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 427</bibl>.—Hence, meton. for <hi rend="ital">Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 79</bibl>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n7273.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to Athens</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Attica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Athenian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Attic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <trans><tr>the Attic territory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1139</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 33, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">Eumolpus (born at Athens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thymus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 177</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cothurnus,</quote> <trans><tr>tragedy</tr>, <tr>which was native to Athens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: domūs opprobrium (on account of Procne, the daughter of the Athenian king Pandion; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Atthis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the fidelity of the friends Theseus and Pirithous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:55" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dote madent pectora,</quote> <trans><tr>full of Athenian wisdom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:69:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 69, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7273.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēcrŏpĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Cecrops; voc.</hi> Cecropidā (i. e. <hi rend="ital">Theseus</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 550</bibl>.—Appel. for <hi rend="ital">one of noble descent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:46 sq" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 46 sq.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cē-crŏpĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Athenians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 486</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 502</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 424</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, § 888</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7273.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēcrŏpĭs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (<hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> Cecropidis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 17, 14</bibl>; <case>voc.</case> Cecropĭ, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 100</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female descendant of Cecrops;</hi> so <hi rend="ital">his daughter Aglauros</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 806</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:797" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 797</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Procne</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 17, 14</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">Procne and Philomele</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughters of Pandion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 667</bibl>.—Also, </sense><sense id="n7273.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An Athenian woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:187" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 187</bibl>; and <pos>adj.</pos> for <hi rend="ital">Attic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Attica</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cedenter: <entryFree id="n7274" type="main" key="ce_denter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēdenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. cedo <sense id="n7274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cedo: <entryFree id="n7275" type="main" key="ce_do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n7275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [perh. for cecado, redupl. from cado], <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be in motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">walk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go along.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7275.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n7275.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare, and only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: for which, in the common lang., incedo); <cit><quote lang="la">candidatus cedit hic mastigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non prorsus, verum transvorsus cedit, quasi cancer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 65</bibl>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n7275.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7275.4" n="1" level="3"> Like ire, <hi rend="ital">to have some result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eventuate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to work;</hi> and, acc. to its connection, <hi rend="ital">to turn out well</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to succeed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gesta quae prospere ei cesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera secundum eventum proelii cessura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:91" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:862" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 862</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:44" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">optime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">male alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utcumque cesserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinione tardius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro bono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vanum (labor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 183" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 183</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n7275.5" n="2" level="3"> Cedere pro aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to be equivalent to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go for</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">to be the price of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves, quae non peperint, binae pro singulis in fructu cedent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 150, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 1, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7275.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n7275.7" n="A" level="2"> In respect to the terminus <hi rend="ital">a quo.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7275.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go from</hi> somewhere, <hi rend="ital">to remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go away from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retire</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cedunt de caelo corpora avium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:96" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 96</bibl></cit> Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia postremus cedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego cedam atque abibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedens carinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 249</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:843" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 843</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquo sucus de corpore cessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma de vertice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e toto corpore anima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ingratā civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:30:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 30, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 25, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 85 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7275.9" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de oppidis,</quote> <trans><tr>to abandon</tr>, <tr>go away from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco,</quote> <trans><tr>to yield</tr>, <tr>give up his post</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 47, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 24</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 63, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 47, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7275.10" n="c" level="4"> In commercial lang. t. t.: foro, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw from the</hi> <cb n="CEDO" /> <hi rend="ital">market</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to give up business</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be insolvent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop payment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:7:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 7, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:39:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 39, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 50</bibl>.—So also, </sense><sense id="n7275.11" n="d" level="4"> Bonis or possessionibus (alicui), <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cede one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s property</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interest</hi> (in favor of a person): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui hortorum possessione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 75</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 82</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 11</bibl>.— Hence of debtors, <hi rend="ital">to make over their property</hi> instead of payment; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 3</bibl>, tit. de cessione bonorum.—</sense><sense id="n7275.12" n="2" level="3"> Pregn. (cf. abeo, II.), <hi rend="ital">to pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disappear;</hi> and specif., </sense><sense id="n7275.13" n="a" level="4"> Of men, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:43:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 43, 4</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">senatu,</quote> <trans><tr>to withdraw from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7275.14" n="b" level="4"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae quidem cedunt et dies et menses et anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 69</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n7275.15" n="c" level="4"> Of other things: pudor ex pectore cessit, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 250, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33, 9</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">excedere memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32, 15</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">excedere e memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 13, 5</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">non Turno fiducia cessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedant curaeque metusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. cesso.—</sense><sense id="n7275.16" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: cedere alicui or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to yield to one</hi> (to his superiority), <hi rend="ital">to give the preference</hi> or <hi rend="ital">precedence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give place to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submit to</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the histt., of the weaker party, withdrawing, fleeing from). </sense><sense id="n7275.17" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To yield to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give place to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quācumque movemur, (aër) videtur quasi locum dare et cedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedebat victa potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi vinci necesse est, expedit cedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:17" default="NO">11, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:47" default="NO">12, 10, 47</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Viriatho exercitus nostri imperatoresque cesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 16</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelides cedere nescius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di, quibus ensis et ignis Cesserunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who remained unhurt in the destruction of Troy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:862" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 862</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eidem tempori, ejusdem furori, eisdem consulibus, eisdem minis, insidiis, periculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:29:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 29, 63</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae ingratorum civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum natu auctoritati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Timoth. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 17, 9</bibl></cit>, and 3, 60, 7; 4, 55, 5; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco iniquo, non hosti cessum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 38, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincentibus vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 95</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n7275.18" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To yield to in rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinction</hi>, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be inferior to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tibi aetas nostra jam cederet, fascesque summitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā aliā re nisi immortalitate cedens caelestibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:61:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 61, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque multum cedebant virtute nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 36</bibl>: Picenis cedunt pomis Tiburtia suco; <cit><quote lang="la">Nam facie praestant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 70</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">anseribus (candore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudibus lanificae artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 529: cum in re nullā Agesilao cederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:108" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui re per aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 59</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non multum Graecis cederetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 6, 8</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7275.19" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To comply with the wishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to yield to one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cessit auctoritati amplissimi viri vel potius paruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 7, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cessit tibi blandienti Cerberus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">cf,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 43 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 704</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 188</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 151</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 16: omnes in unum cedebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 10</bibl> and 41.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7275.20" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: cedere (alicui) aliquid = concedere, <hi rend="ital">to grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permit something to some one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">permitto aliquid iracundiae tuae, do adulescentiae, cedo amicitiae, tribuo parenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa multis de jure suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum ei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam hosti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:4:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui pellicem et regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:7:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dando et cedendo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:290" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 290</bibl></cit>.—Also with a clause as object, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:704" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 704</bibl> (but in <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 67</bibl>, read credit).—And with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac victoriā contenta plebes cessit patribus, ut in praesentiā tribuni crearentur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 41</bibl>: non cedere with <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7275.21" n="B" level="2"> In respect to the terminus <hi rend="ital">ad quem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to arrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attain to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come somewhere</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedunt, petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi ad postremum cedit miles, aes petit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7275.22" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc cedere ad factum volo,</quote> <trans><tr>come to its execution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7275.23" n="C" level="2"> Cedere alicui or in aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to come to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall</hi> (<hi rend="ital">as a possession</hi>) <hi rend="ital">to one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fall to his lot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">share</hi>, <pb n="308" /> <cb n="CEDR" /> <hi rend="ital">accrue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is quaestus huic cederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captiva corpora Romanis cessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 46, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolle ominari quae captae urbi cessura forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:43:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 43, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 297</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 333</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 17</bibl>; 12, 183; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 368</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 533</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae cesserunt piscibus habitandae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 74</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui in usum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lepidi atque Antonii arma in Augustum cessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum ex hostibus captum in paucorum praedam cessisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 45</bibl>; for which: cedere praedae (<case>dat.</case>) alicujus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 19, 12</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda cedit alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Tullo res omnis Albana in Romanum cesserit imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 52, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicionem M. Antonii provinciae cesserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7275.24" n="D" level="2"> Cedere in aliquid, like abire in aliquid (v. abeo, II.), <hi rend="ital">to be changed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to pass into something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be equivalent to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena in vicem fidei cesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritas in gloriam cesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:83:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 83, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proverbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exemplorum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 36</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">cēdenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> of the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> cedens (not used as <pos>P. a.</pos>), <hi rend="ital">by yielding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:16:129" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 16, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7276" type="main" key="ce^do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕdo</orth>, old <sense id="n7276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperat.</hi> form, whose contr. <number>plur.</number> is cette (cf. Prob. II. p. 1486 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 84, 31 sq.</bibl>) [compounded of the particle -ce and the root da-; v. 1. do], <hi rend="ital">hither with it! here! give! tell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say</hi> (implying great haste, familiarity, authority, and so differing from praebe, dic, etc.); cf. Key, § 731. </sense><sense id="n7276.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">hither with it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring here.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7276.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cette manus vestras measque accipite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:320" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. 320</bibl></cit> Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo aquam manibus,</quote> <trans><tr>give water!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum, Phidippe, mihi cedo: ego alam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuam mi dexteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 28</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 84</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cette dextras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senem,</quote> <trans><tr>bring hither the old man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemvis arbitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: eum aliquis cette in conspectum, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 85, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo illum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7276.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Absol.: Al.</hi> En pateram tibi: eccam. <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Cedo mi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 146</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7276.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n7276.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Let us hear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out with it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, age, cedo istuc tuom consilium: quid id est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum cedo auctorem tui facti, unius profer exemplum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 5, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo mihi unum, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>, § 29: cedo, si vos in eo loco essetis, quid aliud fecissetis? Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 21</bibl>: cedo, cujum puerum hic apposuisti? dic mihi. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 24</bibl>; cf. Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 82</bibl>; Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 85, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo igitur, quid faciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:71:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 71, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:43:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 43, § 106</bibl>: cedo, si conata peregit, <hi rend="ital">tell how</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:210" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 210</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:504" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 504</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo dum, en unquam audisti, etc.?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7276.6" n="B" level="2"> In respect to action, cedo = fac, ut, <hi rend="ital">grant that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let me</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo ut bibam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo ut inspiciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego, statim, cedo, inquam si quid ab Attico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl></cit>, a, 1.—</sense><sense id="n7276.7" n="C" level="2"> For calling attention, <hi rend="ital">lo! behold! well!</hi> cedo mihi leges Atinias, Furias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:42:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 42, § 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo mihi ipsius Verris testimonium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>, § 84; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 75</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:86:295" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 86, 295</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 50, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cedo ut admoveam templis, et farre litabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:75" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo experiamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 298, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cedrelate: <entryFree id="n7277" type="main" key="ce_^dre^la^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cē^drĕlătē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kedrela)th</foreign>, <sense id="n7277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cedar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fir-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a large kind of cedar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 5, 11, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:17" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 5, 11, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cedreus: <entryFree id="n7278" type="hapax" key="ce_^dre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cē^drĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cedrus</etym>, <sense id="n7278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of cedar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cedria: <entryFree id="n7279" type="greek" key="ce_^dri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cē^drĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kedri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pitch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resin from cedar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:32:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:70 al" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 7, 24, § 70 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cedrinus: <entryFree id="n7280" type="greek" key="ce_^dri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cē^drĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ke)drinos</foreign>, <sense id="n7280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of cedar-wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cedar-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 79, § 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 5, 11, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 24, § 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cedris: <entryFree id="n7281" type="greek" key="ce_^dris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cē^dris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kedri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fruit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">berry of the cedar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 5, 12, § 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cedrium: <entryFree id="n7282" type="greek" key="ce_^dri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cē^drĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ke/drion</foreign>, <sense id="n7282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cedar-oil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 11, 21, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cedrostis: <entryFree id="n7283" type="greek" key="cedrostis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cedrostis</orth>, <case>acc.</case> <itype>cedrostim</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ke/drwstis</foreign>,<cb n="CELE" />  <sense id="n7283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the names of the white vine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cedrus: <entryFree id="n7284" type="greek" key="ce_^drus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cē^drus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ke/dros</foreign>, <sense id="n7284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cedar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">juniper-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juniperus oxycedrus, Linn., which has a very fragrant wood, and furnishes an oil that protects from decay,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 5, 11, § 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:203" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 40, 76, § 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 13</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">cedar-wood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 414</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:8" default="NO">8, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7284.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">cedar-oil</hi> (with which the backs of books were usually anointed to preserve them from moths and decay): <cit><quote lang="la">liber flavus cedro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perunctus cedro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. Becker, Gall. 2, p. 219.— Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina linenda cedro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>worthy of immortality</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedro digna locutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:42" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
celadon: <entryFree id="n7285" type="main" key="Ce^la^don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕlădon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*keladw/n</foreign>. <sense id="n7285.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Egyptian companion of Phineus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 144</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7285.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Lapithœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 250</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
