celaenae: <entryFree id="n7286" type="main" key="Ce^laenae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕlaenae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kelainai/</foreign>, <sense id="n7286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Phrygia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Mœander</hi>, where, acc. to the fable, occurred the contest of Marsyas with Apollo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:186" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 186</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7286.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕlaenaeus</orth>, a. <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Celœnœ</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to Marsyas</hi>: concubinus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Atthis</hi>, who was born in Celænæ, and loved by Cybele, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:41" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 41</bibl>' amores, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:204" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marsyas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buxus, i. e. tibia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:666" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 666</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
celaeno: <entryFree id="n7287" type="main" key="Ce^laeno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕlaeno</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kelainw/</foreign>. <sense id="n7287.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Atlas and Pleione</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and one of the Pleiades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7287.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Harpies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 211</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 365</bibl>.— Hence, appel. for <hi rend="ital">an avaricious woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:130" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celate: <entryFree id="n7288" type="main" key="ce_la_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēlātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>celo</etym>, <sense id="n7288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
celatim: <entryFree id="n7289" type="main" key="ce_la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privately</hi> (very rare), Sisenn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 151, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celator: <entryFree id="n7290" type="hapax" key="ce_la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a concealer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hider</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 286</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celatum: <entryFree id="n7291" type="main" key="ce_la_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēlātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a secret</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 15</bibl> (19).</sense></entryFree>
celeber: <entryFree id="n7292" type="main" key="ce^le^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlĕber</orth>, <itype>ē^bris, ē^bre</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<sense id="n7292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> celebris, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 88 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 10</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> very rare, but <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> freq.) [perh. Sanscr. çru-, audire; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kle/os</foreign>; v. Corss. Beitr. p. 368], <hi rend="ital">that which contains a multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">numerous;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n7292.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Where there is a multitude</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">where a multitude comes together;</hi> of places, <hi rend="ital">much frequented</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resorted to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">populous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich in</hi> (syn.: plenus, frequens; opp. desertus): celeber <foreign lang="greek">polu/andros</foreign>, Gloss. Vet.: <cit><quote lang="la">in locis illa fortuita: culti an inculti, celebres an deserti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:10:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 10, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 67, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:65:section=159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 65, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 24, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco celebri an secreto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro celeberrimo, tantā frequentiā,</quote> <trans><tr>most frequented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:58:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 58, § 133</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: celeberrimo fori,</quote> <trans><tr>at the time when the Forum was most frequented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus celeberrimus atque plenissimus navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeberrimo virorum mulierumque conventu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 15, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celebri urbe et copiosā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeberrimo loco (urbis) elatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars oppidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 19, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeberrima fontibus Ide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeberrimus ilice lucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7292.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7292.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That is celebrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honored by a great assembly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">train</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi> (syn.: clarus, notus, nobilis; in prose and poetry, partic. since the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n7292.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentis Aquitanae celeber Messala triumphis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies omni caerimoniarum genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiresias famā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Daedalus ingenio artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir arte grammaticā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisque ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunus plebis opibus, gratiā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:18:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pons Mulvius nocturnis illecebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7292.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies celeberrimi laetissimique,</quote> <trans><tr>most solemn</tr>, <tr>festive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res totā Siciliā celeberrima atque notissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 61</bibl></cit>: celebre per Hispaniam responsum,<cb n="CELE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19, 8</bibl>: fama inter barbaros <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen ad posteros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 27, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:17:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arminius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 747</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:412" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 412</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: Aper et Secundus, celeberrima tum ingema fori nostri. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7292.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeberrimus fuit in hoc genere Sosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 60, § 184</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7292.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Often repeated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">numerous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequent</hi> (very rare): celebri gradu, <hi rend="ital">with double quick step</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 89, 25</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 25 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba celeberrima,</quote> <trans><tr>often repeated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis celeber trans maria et quondam in Campania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 1, 2, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina in annalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl></cit> (6), 7, 1.</sense></entryFree>
celebrabilis: <entryFree id="n7293" type="main" key="ce^le_^bra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlē^brābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>celebro</etym>, <sense id="n7293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">commendable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">favor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 5, 56</bibl></cit>; Ambros. de Cain et Abel, 2, 3, 12 al.</sense></entryFree>
celebratio: <entryFree id="n7294" type="main" key="ce^le_^bra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlē^brātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n7294.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A numerous assemblage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concourse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum coetus et celebrationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae domus? quae celebratio cottidiana?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 26, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7294.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The celebrating of a festival in great numbers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a festal celebration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a festival</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 29, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 3, § 12</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n7294.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An honoring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a commending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praising</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celebrationem habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be valued</tr>, <tr>esteemed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 10, § 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
celebrator: <entryFree id="n7295" type="hapax" key="ce^le_^bra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlē^brātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who extols</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a celebrator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:78" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
celebratus: <entryFree id="n7296" type="main" key="ce^le_^bra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlē^brātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>celebro</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
celebresco: <entryFree id="n7297" type="hapax" key="ce^le_^bresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlē^bresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n7297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [celeber], <hi rend="ital">to become renowned</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 89, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celebritas: <entryFree id="n7298" type="main" key="ce^le_^bri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlē^brĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n7298.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A great number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a large assembly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a numerous concourse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gathering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a crowd</hi> (syn. frequentia; opp. solitudo; <cit><quote lang="la">in good prose): in multitudine et celebritate judiciorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 29</bibl>: odi celebritatem; fugio homines; <cit><quote lang="la">esset mihi ista solitudo non amara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl>: in celebritate versari, <hi rend="ital">to live in society</hi>, Nep. praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">6: virorum ac mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:29 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 29 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius Graeciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7298.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7298.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A festal celebration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a solemnity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremi diei,</quote> <trans><tr>a solemn procession for the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:32:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 32, 86</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 38, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7298.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celebritas sermonis hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:19:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 19, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa celebritatis et nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 5:6, p. 243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 5, 6, p. 243</bibl></cit> Gerl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in docendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:17:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 1, 2, § 2</bibl></cit>; v. Sillig <hi rend="ital">N cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
celebriter: <entryFree id="n7299" type="main" key="ce^le_^bri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlē^brĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">frequently;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per noctes celeberrime acclamatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 52</bibl></cit> Oud. (Roth, creberrime).</sense></entryFree>
celebro: <entryFree id="n7300" type="main" key="ce^le_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlē^bro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n7300.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go to a place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">person in great numbers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to frequent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi> (syn. frequento; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): deūm delubra festis diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:63:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 63, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 34, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:703" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:444" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 144</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">forum maxime celebratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penates, i. e. domum redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me magistrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7300.1" n="b" level="4"> Of a desired action (cf. celeber, B.), <hi rend="ital">to do something frequently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in multitudes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to practise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeat</hi>, = frequento, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">intro abite atque haec cito celebrate,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in company</tr>, <tr>all together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eas artes, quibus a pueris dediti fuimus, celebrandas inter nosque recolendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitionem exercitationemque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus divinationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">celebratum genus mortis,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of death suffered by many</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisdictionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popularem potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 42, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iambum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seria ac jocos cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7300.2" n="c" level="4"> Aliquid aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to fill up with something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contiones suas convicio cantorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripas carmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 252</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concelebrant ripas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 345</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">cujus litteris, famā, nuntiis celebrantur aures cottidie meae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are filled</tr>, <tr>full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 22</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: juvenes multo sermone, <hi rend="ital">to talk much with</hi> <pb n="309" /> <cb n="CELE" /> <hi rend="ital">them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7300.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7300.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go in great numbers to a celebration;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to celebrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solemnize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep a festival</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">festos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">is (dies) festus celebratusque per omnem Africam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 37, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 65 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium omnium sermone laetitiāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 59</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">coetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 555</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">solemnia nuptiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium nuptiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl></cit>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedas jugales Thetidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annua sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 173</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 598</bibl> and 603: funus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 117</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">exsequias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 22, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem natalem Vitellii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 102</bibl> (103): <cit><quote lang="la">natales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 30, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 18</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā celebrante Siciliā sepultus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n7300.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrate the praises of a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to celebrate in song</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">colere, laudare, illustrare): laus, quae non poetarum carminibus, non annalium monumentis celebratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:39:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 39, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrum egressum ornando atque celebrando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna res cunctas ex libidine magis quam ex vero celebrat obscuratque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia carminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen alicujus scriptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta pro maxumis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domestica facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 287</bibl></cit>: se remque publicam haec faciundo, <hi rend="ital">to make renowned</hi>, Sall J. 85, 36: Mari virtutem in majus ( = <foreign lang="greek">e)pi\ to\ mei=zon kosmei=n</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 73, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">augereque aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 86, 3</bibl></cit>: honores alicujus, <hi rend="ital">celebrate one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s honor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 840</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam ingenti fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 39 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum aut heroa lyrā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum hominum conventu et epulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 38, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam nominis epulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora ludis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam magno assensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem funere censorio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem admiratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funere publico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 11</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n7300.6" n="C" level="2"> Without the access. idea of extolling, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to make something known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to publish abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus in locis factum esse consulem Murenam nuntii litteraeque celebrassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 41, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vocibus maledictisque celebratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā re celebratā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 17, 31</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlĕbrā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n7300.7" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to I. a.) <hi rend="ital">Frequented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">much visited</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum rerum venalium totius regni maxime celebratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 47, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7300.8" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. b.) <hi rend="ital">Customary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tritum atque celebratum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celebratum est usque in proverbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">schemata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus anuli celebratior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum celebratius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 25</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:25:section=17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 25, § 17</bibl>: verbum crebrius, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:25:section=18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 25, § 18</bibl>: verbum creberrimum).—</sense><sense id="n7300.9" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to II. A.) <hi rend="ital">Solemn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">festive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brilliant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies celebratior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicatio celebratior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 63, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7300.10" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci famā celebrati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo Actiacae victoriae memoria celebratior in posterum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, v. celebriter.</sense></entryFree>
celeja: <entryFree id="n7301" type="main" key="Cele_ja"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Celēja</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Celēĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Noricum, now <hi rend="ital">Cilly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Stiria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 24, 17, § 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 501</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1982</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celelates: <entryFree id="n7302" type="main" key="Celela_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Celelātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Ligurian tribe</hi>, mentioned only by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 29, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celemna: <entryFree id="n7303" type="main" key="Ce^lemna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕlemna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕlenna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Campania</hi>, mentioned only by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 739</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celenderis: <entryFree id="n7304" type="main" key="Ce^lende^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕlendĕris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-dris</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kele/nderis</foreign>, <sense id="n7304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortified harbor in</hi> Cilicia, now <hi rend="ital">Kelenderi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Turkish Gulnar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:13:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 80</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕlendĕrī-tis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Celenderis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
celer: <entryFree id="n7305" type="main" key="ce^ler1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕler</orth>, <itype>ĕris, e</itype> (<sense id="n7305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕleris</orth>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 760</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> celer, Liv. Andron. ap. Prisc. l. l.; cf. acer; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> celerissimus, Enn. and Manlius ap. Prisc. l. l.) [cello; cf. Doed. Syn. 2, pp. 123 and 93, urging, pressing forward; cf. also 1. cello], <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedy</hi> (with the access. idea of energy, struggling, and even power; v. Doed. above <cb n="CELE" /> cited; syn.: expeditus, promptus, velox, citatus; opp. tardus, segnis, lentus). </sense><sense id="n7305.1" n="I" level="1"> Of corporeal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">face te propere celerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta, Liv. Andron. ap. Prisc. l. l.: sagitta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 367</bibl>: configebat tardus celeres (sc. aves), Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercurius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynthia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curriculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 192</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 302</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 177</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">celer atque instabilis motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 324</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 216</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:855" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 855</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:3:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:91" default="NO">4, 1, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 63, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lintres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 9, 18: <cit><quote lang="la">remedia,</quote> <trans><tr>quickly working</tr>, <tr>efficacious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">gen. gerund</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:587" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 587</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excipere aprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 11</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 25</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, celer for celeriter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 838</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 765</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7305.2" n="II" level="1"> Of mental and abstract objects: <cit><quote lang="la">oderunt Sedatum celeres,</quote> <trans><tr>lively</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:73" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens, quā nihil est celerius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:200" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59, 200</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 183</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio celeris et concitata,</quote> <trans><tr>rapid</tr>, <tr>hurried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 88</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:138" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9" default="NO">9</bibl>. 4, 83; 9, 4, 111; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 4, 135: consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7305.3" n="B" level="2"> Implying reproach, <hi rend="ital">rash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precipitate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 32, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 38, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 51, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so iambi (of the fire of youth),</quote> <trans><tr>rash</tr>, <tr>hasty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperatio rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:255" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:775" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 775</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata celerrima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:205" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 205</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi> (syn.: velociter, cito, continuo, confestim, festinanter). </sense><sense id="n7305.4" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlĕrĕ</orth>, Enn. et Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 510, 9 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7305.5" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlĕrĭter</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 27, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 52</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> celerius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 3, 24, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:3:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 3, 2 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> celerrime, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:37 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 37 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7306" type="main" key="Ce^ler2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕler</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen in the</hi> gens Caecilia, Domitia, Egnatia, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:89:305" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 89, 305</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n7307" type="main" key="Ce^ler3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕler</orth>, v. Celeres.</entryFree>
celeranter: <entryFree id="n7308" type="main" key="ce^le^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>celero</etym>, <sense id="n7308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with speed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in haste</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 513, 25</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 123 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
celeratim: <entryFree id="n7309" type="hapax" key="ce^le^ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlĕrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 87, 2</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 15, 2</bibl>, has celatim).</sense></entryFree>
celere: <entryFree id="n7310" type="main" key="ce^le^re^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlĕrĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. celer, II. B. a.</entryFree>
celeres: <entryFree id="n7311" type="main" key="Ce^le^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕlĕres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ke/leres</foreign> [cello, those who are prominent in position, = celsi; acc. to some from <foreign lang="greek">kelhs</foreign>, eques], the orig. general name for <sense id="n7311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">patricians</hi> or <hi rend="ital">knights</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 9, § 35</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=42" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 42</bibl> (cf. Nieb. Röm. Gesch. 1, p. 367 sq.; O. Müll. Etrusk. 1, p. 382; and v. Trossuli and Flexuntes); <cit><quote lang="la">in particular,</quote> <trans><tr>the body-guard of the king</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:7" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 59, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 603</bibl>, and Nieb. and Müll. above cited.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕler</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the chief of the Celeres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:837" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 837</bibl>; Paul. ex Fest. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
celeripes: <entryFree id="n7312" type="main" key="ce^le^ri^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlĕrĭpēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>celer-pes</etym>, <sense id="n7312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swiftfooted</hi> (very rare), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 1</bibl>; besides only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 141</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Parent. 27, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celeritas: <entryFree id="n7313" type="main" key="ce^le^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>celer</etym>, <sense id="n7313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swiftness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celerity</hi> (in good prose; syn.: velocitas, pernicitas; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. tarditas): velocitas corporis celeritas appellatur, quae eadem ingenii laus habetur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritas et vis equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:70:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 70, 144</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in capiendis castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneni,</quote> <trans><tr>the quick effect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibili celeritate de victoriā Caesaris fama perfertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritati studere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Favonio Scipionis celeritas salutem attulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 36</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximum bonum in celeritate putabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 43, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritate uti,</quote> <trans><tr>to employ speed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. absol.</hi>: cavendum est ne in festinationibus <cb n="CELL" /> suscipiamus nimias celeritates, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 36, 131</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7313.1" n="2" level="3"> Of intellectual and abstract objects: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: inge nii, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">calliditas et celeritas ingenii,</quote> <trans><tr>quickness of device</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:111" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:191" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 57, 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:88" default="NO">9, 4, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:140" default="NO">9, 4, 140</bibl>; 11, 3, 107.</sense></entryFree>
celeriter: <entryFree id="n7314" type="main" key="ce^le^ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlĕrĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. celer <sense id="n7314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
celeritudo: <entryFree id="n7315" type="hapax" key="ce^le^ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlĕrĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>celer</etym>, = celeritas, <sense id="n7315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swiftness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12, 6</bibl> (considered by Schneid. as a gloss).</sense></entryFree>
celeriuscule: <entryFree id="n7316" type="hapax" key="ce^le^ri^uscu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlĕrĭuscŭlē</orth>, <sense id="n7316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat quickly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeriuscule dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 5, p. 611</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
celero: <entryFree id="n7317" type="main" key="ce^le^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, or in post-Aug. prose). <sense id="n7317.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to quicken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accelerate;</hi> syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">festinare, properare): casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam in silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter inceptum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 609</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:574" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:720" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 720</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:251" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 251</bibl></cit>: haec celerans, <hi rend="ital">hastening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">executing this</hi> (<hi rend="ital">message</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 656</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to execute quickly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:80" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obpugnationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 46</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itineribus celeratis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celerandae victoriae intentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7317.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make haste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be quick</hi> (cf. accelero and propero): <cit><quote lang="la">circum celerantibus auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 388</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:64" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 4, 20</bibl> (but not <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 10</bibl>; v. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
celes: <entryFree id="n7318" type="greek" key="ce^le_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlēs</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ke/lhs</foreign>. <sense id="n7318.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A racer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">race-horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 10, § 19</bibl>; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 635</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7318.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A swift-sailing vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a yacht</hi>, pure Lat. celox, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 208</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celetizontes: <entryFree id="n7319" type="greek" key="Ce^le_ti_zontes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕlētīzontes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kelhtizontes</foreign>, <sense id="n7319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">riders upon race-horses</hi>, a piece of statuary by Canachus and Hegias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19</bibl>, §§ 75 and 78.</sense></entryFree>
celetrum: <entryFree id="n7320" type="main" key="Celetrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Celetrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n7320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Macedonia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Castoria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 40, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celeuma: <entryFree id="n7321" type="main" key="ce^leuma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕleuma</orth>, v. celeusma.</entryFree>
celeus: <entryFree id="n7322" type="main" key="Ce^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕlĕus</orth>, <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*keleo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king in Eleusis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Triptolemus. He or his son was taught agriculture by Ceres</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom he entertained as a guest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 147" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:508" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 508</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 165</bibl> Serv. et Philarg.</sense></entryFree>
celeusma: <entryFree id="n7323" type="greek" key="ce^leusma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕleusma</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕleuma</orth>), <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕleusma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Ven. Vita S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:423" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 423</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">ke/leusma (ke/leuma</foreign>), <sense id="n7323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a command</hi> or <hi rend="ital">call given by the chief oarsman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which gave the time to the rowers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:67:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 67, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> 1, 370</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Div. in Caecil. 17:55" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Div. in Caecil. 17, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celia: <entryFree id="n7324" type="foreign" key="ce_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēlĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cael-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <sense id="n7324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of beer made in Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 82, § 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 18, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 3, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cella: <entryFree id="n7325" type="main" key="cella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. celo, oc-cul-o, clam, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:33:45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 33, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=50" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 50</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n7325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a storeroom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chamber.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7325.1" n="I" level="1"> In agricult. lang., <hi rend="ital">a place for depositing grain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fruits</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">for the abode of animals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a granary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stall</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">olearia, vinaria, penaria, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:3" default="NO">12, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 87, § 200</bibl> sq. al.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbarum,</quote> <trans><tr>dovecotes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anserum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 14, 9</bibl></cit>.— Also of the <hi rend="ital">cells of bees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 433</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 11, 10, § 26</bibl>.—Hence, dare, emere, imperare aliquid in cellam, <hi rend="ital">to furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure the things necessary for a house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the kitchen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:87:section=201 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 87, § 201 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10, 30</bibl>. —Facetiously: <cit><quote lang="la">cella promptuaria = carcer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqui in ventre cellae uni locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 17</bibl></cit>.- </sense><sense id="n7325.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the small, simple dwelling apartments of men, <hi rend="ital">a chamber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">closet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cabinet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cot</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. of servants,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14</bibl></cit>: ostiarii, <hi rend="ital">the porter</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s lodge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 29, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">77, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of slaves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 8 al.</bibl>—Of a poor man's garret, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:20:21" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 20, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:14:5" default="NO">8, 14, 5</bibl>: cella pauperis, <hi rend="ital">a chamber for self-denial</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:100:6" default="NO">100, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:48" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7325.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The part of a temple in which the image of a god stood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the chapel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1</bibl>; Cic. <pb n="310" /> <cb n="CELO" /> Phil. 3, 12, 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 50, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:29:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 29, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7325.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An apartment in a bathing-house</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 40, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7325.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A room in a brothel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:128" default="NO">6, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:45:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 45, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cellararius: <entryFree id="n7326" type="main" key="cella_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cellārārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = cellarius, <sense id="n7326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a steward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">butler</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cellariensis: <entryFree id="n7327" type="main" key="cella_ri^ensi^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cellārĭensĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cella</etym>, <sense id="n7327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to a store-room</hi>: species, Cod. Th. 7, 4, 32; 11, 28, 16.</sense></entryFree>
cellariolum: <entryFree id="n7328" type="hapax" key="cella_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cellārĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cellarium</etym>, <sense id="n7328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little chamber</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cellaris: <entryFree id="n7329" type="main" key="cella_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cellāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. cellarius.</entryFree>
cellarium: <entryFree id="n7330" type="main" key="cella_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cellārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cellarius</etym> (post-class. access. form to cella), <sense id="n7330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a receptacle for food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pantry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:41:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 41, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11:93" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:21:204" default="NO">3, 21, 204</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7330.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provisions</hi>, Cod. Th. 1, 10, 3.</sense></entryFree>
cellarius: <entryFree id="n7331" type="main" key="cella_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cellārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (access. form <sense id="n7331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> cellares, perh. for the purpose of avoiding the <hi rend="ital">os</hi> four times repeated, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 1</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cella</etym>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a storeroom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7331.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cellārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who keeps provisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a steward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">butler</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:9" default="NO">12, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:2" default="NO">12, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:188 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 12, 62, § 188 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cellatio: <entryFree id="n7332" type="hapax" key="cella_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cellātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a series of store-rooms</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chambers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 77, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cello: <entryFree id="n7333" type="gloss" key="cello1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cello</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, found only in the compounds percello, procello; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ke/llw</foreign>; Sanscr. kar, to kill; and Lat.: celer, celox.</entryFree>
