<entryFree id="n7334" type="gloss" key="cello2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cello</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, found only in the compounds antecello, excello, praecello; v. celsus <sense id="n7334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cellula: <entryFree id="n7335" type="main" key="cellu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cellŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cella</etym>, <sense id="n7335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small store-room</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apartment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 9, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and acc. to cella, II. D.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cellulanus: <entryFree id="n7336" type="hapax" key="cellu^la_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cellŭlānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cellula</etym>, <sense id="n7336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hermit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recluse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celmis: <entryFree id="n7337" type="main" key="Celmis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Celmis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ke/lmis</foreign>, <sense id="n7337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Dactyli</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Corybantes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">priests of Cybele;</hi> for despising Jupiter, changed by him to adamas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 282</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celo: <entryFree id="n7338" type="main" key="ce_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (contract. form of the <sense id="n7338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur. part. pass.</hi> celatum = celatorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 15</bibl> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>) [cf. caligo], <hi rend="ital">to hide something from one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to conceal;</hi> constr., </sense><sense id="n7338.1" n="I" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">a double acc.</hi>, as in Gr <foreign lang="greek">kru/ptw tina/ ti</foreign>; cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 391 (class. in prose and poetry): neque enim id est celare, quicquid reticeas; <cit><quote lang="la">sed cum, quod tu scias, id ignorare emolumenti tui causā velis eos, quorum intersit id scire, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te atque alios partum ut celaret suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea ne me celet, consuefeci filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non te celavi sermonem T. Ampii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter omnis celat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tegat hoc celetque viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:149" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 149</bibl></cit>.—Rare, aliquem de aliquā re: <cit><quote lang="la">de armis, de ferro, de insidiis celare te noluit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 20, 3</bibl> (more freq. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>).—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: celor rem, but more freq. celor hoc, illud, etc., <hi rend="ital">something is concealed from me</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosne hoc celatos tam diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen indicabo tibi quod mehercule inprimis celatum volebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—More freq. celor de re: <cit><quote lang="la">non est profecto de illo veneno celata mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 66, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credo celatum esse Cassium de Sullā uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debes existimare te maximis de rebus a fratre esse celatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod neque celari Alexandrini possent in apparanda fugā, Auct. B. Alex. 7.— More rare, mihi res celatur: id Alcibiadi diutius celari non potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 2</bibl></cit> (al. Alcibiades).—</sense><sense id="n7338.2" n="II" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">one acc.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7338.3" n="A" level="2"> With <case>acc.</case> of the direct object: aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to conceal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover;</hi> and of persons: aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal one.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7338.4" n="1" level="3"> Aliquid (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">celem tam insperatum gaudium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 60</bibl></cit>: crudelia consilia dulci formā, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 175</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontium origines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol diem qui Promis et celas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus uterum,</quote> <trans><tr>to conceal by covering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:683" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 683</bibl></cit>.—With <case>dat.</case> (locat.) <hi rend="ital">of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra alia terrae celavimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5</bibl></cit>. 5, 1, § 9 Weissenb. ad loc. (al. terrā).— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod celatum est atque occultatum usque adhuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. id. <cb n="CELS" /> Trin. 1, 2, 127: <cit><quote lang="la">quod turpiter factum celari poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:80:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 80, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum tertia pars celata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor celatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut celetur consuetio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:904" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 904</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1159" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:34" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 25, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 516</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n7338.5" n="2" level="3"> Aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerosque hi qui receperant, celant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem silvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 417</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 443</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugitivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se tenebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a domino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 17</bibl></cit> pr.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu celari (virgo) non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celabitur auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillamento celatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7338.6" n="B" level="2"> With <case>acc.</case> of the remote object: celare aliquem (diff. from the preced.), <hi rend="ital">to conceal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide from one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis hospitalis numen numquam celare potuisset, homines fortasse celavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 13, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 13 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celabar, excludebar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl> (16), 5: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego celari possum, quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7338.7" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est celandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celatum indagator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cēlāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">secrets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et celata omnia Paene pessum dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
celostrataantepagmenta: <entryFree id="n7339" type="hapax" key="celostrata antepagmenta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">celostrata antepagmenta</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6, 6</bibl>; of unknown signif. and various readings (others propose cerostrota, inlaid with horn; and others, clathrata, furnished with a trellis; v. Schneid. ad h. l.).</entryFree>
celox: <entryFree id="n7340" type="main" key="ce^lox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĕlox</orth>, <itype>ōcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>celer, cello</etym> (orig. <pos>adj.</pos>, related to celer, as atrox to ater, ferox to ferus, etc.; cf. Doed. Syn. 2, p. 123; later <sense id="n7340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, sc. navis, ratis, etc.), <hi rend="ital">a swift-sailing ship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cutter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yacht</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">ke/lhs</foreign>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1, 22</bibl>; Varr. and Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 533, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 17, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celocem (celetem, Sillig),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 208</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Isid. Orig. l. l.: publica,</quote> <trans><tr>a packet-boat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 94</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">humorously for a full belly,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7340.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, but with reference to the first signif., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 40</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:40 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 40 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
celse: <entryFree id="n7341" type="main" key="celse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">celsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. celsus <sense id="n7341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
celsitudo: <entryFree id="n7342" type="main" key="celsi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">celsĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>celsus</etym>. <sense id="n7342.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lofty carriage of the body</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:94" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 94</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n7342.1" n="II" level="1"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">a title; your Highness</hi>, Cod. Th. 1, 6, 6; 9, 1, 15 al.</sense></entryFree>
celsus: <entryFree id="n7343" type="main" key="celsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">celsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><pos>P. a.</pos>, of obsolete 2. cello, found in antecello, excello, etc., to rise high, tower; root kar-, in <foreign lang="greek">ka/rh, ka/rhnon, ko/rus</foreign>; cerebrum, crista, pro-ceres; calamus, culmus, columna, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n7343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">raised high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extending upward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi> (syn.: altus, erectus, sublimis, elatus, procerus). </sense><sense id="n7343.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically: <cit><quote lang="la">(deus homines) humo excitatos, celsos et erectos constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsissimo Germano procerior (Judaeus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">status (oratoris) et erectus et celsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 32, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and celsior ingressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cornua cervus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 538</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">surgens in cornua cervus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 725</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">capitolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acherontia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apenninus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex montis, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 7, 13: celsa Paphus atque Cythera,</quote> <trans><tr>lofty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne, si celsior (ibis), ignis adurat (opp. demissior),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 205</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7343.2" n="II" level="1"> Morally. </sense><sense id="n7343.3" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense. </sense><sense id="n7343.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">High</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevated above that which is common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">erectus, eminens, excellens, altus): celsus et erectus et ea, quae homini accidere possunt, omnia parva ducens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generosior celsiorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:188" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 188</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7343.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Elevated in rank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsissima sedes dignitatis atque honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:42" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. under <pos>adv.</pos> and Celeres.—</sense><sense id="n7343.6" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">haughty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">high-spirited</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec jura suae civitatis ignorantem, erectum et celsum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsi et spe haud dubia feroces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsi Ramnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 342</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:187" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 187</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">celsē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n7343.7" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">High; comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:19:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 19, 2</bibl>; Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 387</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7343.8" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Nobly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:145" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 145</bibl></cit> (others read: celso natorum honore).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7344" type="main" key="Celsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Celsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen;</hi> esp., </sense><sense id="n7344.1" n="I" level="1"> A. Cornelius Celsus, <hi rend="ital">the greatest of the Roman writers on medicine.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n7344.2" n="II" level="1"> C. <cb n="CENA" /> Albinovanus, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Horace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celtae: <entryFree id="n7345" type="main" key="Celtae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*keltai/</foreign>, <sense id="n7345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great parent - stock of people in the north of Europe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Celts;</hi> among the Romans, in a more restricted sense, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Middle Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:105 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 105 sq.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n7345.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n7345.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Celtic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Middle Gaul</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17</bibl></cit> 31, § <cit><quote lang="la">105: spolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the Celtic language</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 12, § 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7345.3" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to the wide signif. of the Greeks.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a people in interior Spain and on the river Guadiana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:2" default="NO">3, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 111</bibl>; also <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Celtica gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; and Promonturium, <hi rend="ital">in Gallœcia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Capo Finisterre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 111</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7345.4" n="C" level="2"> (In a broader sense.) <hi rend="ital">Celtic</hi> = <hi rend="ital">of Upper Italy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:46" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 46</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n7345.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. terra), <hi rend="ital">the Celtic country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 13, 14, § 34</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7345.6" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. nomen or imperium), <hi rend="ital">the Celtic nation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Celts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
celtiberi: <entryFree id="n7346" type="main" key="Celti^be_ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtĭbēri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kelti/bhres</foreign>, <sense id="n7346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Celtiberians</hi>, a people in Middle Spain, which originated (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 10</bibl>) by a mingling of the Celts with the native-born Iberians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:19 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 19 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:9" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:13" default="NO">2, 17, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22:1 al" default="NO">3, 22, 1 al.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtĭbēr</orth>, <itype>ēri</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a Celtiberian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 17</bibl> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>— Hence, </sense><sense id="n7346.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtĭbēr</orth>, <itype>ēra, ērum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Celtiberian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7346.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtĭbērĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*keltibhri/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the land of the Celtiberians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Celtiberia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:28" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:87 al" default="NO">4, 2, 87 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Celtiberia terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7346.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtĭ-bērĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Celtiberian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:21" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtĭbērĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the Celtiberic language</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 12, § 40</bibl> (ex conj. Sillig).</sense></entryFree>
celtice: <entryFree id="n7347" type="main" key="Celti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Celtae, II. A.</entryFree>
celticus: <entryFree id="n7348" type="main" key="Celti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Celtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Celtae, II.</entryFree>
celtis: <entryFree id="n7349" type="foreign" key="celtis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">celtis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an African species of lotus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 17, 32, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cemos: <entryFree id="n7350" type="greek" key="ce_mo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēmŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">khmo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 35, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cena: <entryFree id="n7351" type="main" key="ce_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēna</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">coena</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">caena</orth>; old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">caesna</orth>; cf. <sense id="n7351.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Casmena for Camena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205, 15</bibl></cit> Müll.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. khad-, eat; Umbr. çes-na; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kni/zw</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">the principal meal of the Romans in the early period</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taken about midday</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dinner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supper</hi> (Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=54:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 54, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=338:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 338, 4</bibl> and 368, 8 Müll.); subsequently, the prandium was taken at noon, and the cena was usually begun about the 9th hour, i. e. at 3 o'clock P. M. (v. Dict. of Antiq. s. v. coena; cf.: prandium, jentaculum): cena apud antiquos dicebatur quod nunc est prandium. Vesperna, quam nunc cenam appellamus, Paul. ex Fest. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:8:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">to begin sooner was an indication of gluttony,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 49, 6</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n7351.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenarum ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput cenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mullus cenae caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:31:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus cenae fundus et fundamentum omne erat aula una lentis Aegyptiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: genus cenae sollemne, viaticum, adventicium, geniale, Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honos cenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inpensae cenarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenarum magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:48:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 48, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo cenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o noctes cenaeque deūm!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mero Pontificum potiore cenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 14, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thyestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenae adhibere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 31, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurus accipiebat nos Athenis cenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenam cenavi tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obire cenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: cenam condicere alicui, <hi rend="ital">to engage one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to any one as a guest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promise to be one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s guest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7351.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante cenam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">115, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter cenam,</quote> <trans><tr>at table</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:6:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 6, § 19</bibl></cit>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Phil. 2:25:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in this sense in Suet. several times: super cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 19</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem Abduxi ad cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad cenam aliquo condicam foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">holera et pisciculos ferre in cenam seni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit aliquid in cenam,</quote> <trans><tr>is preparing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire ad cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire ad cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:6:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 6, § 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itare ad cenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitare ad cenam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire ad cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promittere ad cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocare ad cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">devocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redire a cenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 98</bibl></cit>. —Prov.: cenā comesā venire, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to come too late</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post festum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenam rapere de rogo,</quote> <trans><tr>of unscrupulous greed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 59, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7351.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7351.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A dish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, at dinner: <cit><quote lang="la">prima, altera, tertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 31, 5</bibl></cit> and 6.—* </sense><sense id="n7351.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A company at table</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens cena sedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 120</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n7351.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The place of an entertainment</hi> (cf. cenatio and cenaculum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cenacularius: <entryFree id="n7352" type="main" key="ce_na_cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnācŭlārĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caen-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cenaculum</etym>, <sense id="n7352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a garret;</hi> only twice <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n7352.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnācŭlā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a tenant of a garret</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:11:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 11, § 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7352.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnācŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a leasing of a garret</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:5:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 3, 5, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cenaculatus: <entryFree id="n7353" type="main" key="ce_na_cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnācŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with garrets</hi>: domus, Marin. Papir. Dipl. 123, § 2.</sense></entryFree>
cenaculum: <entryFree id="n7354" type="main" key="ce_na_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnācŭlum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caen-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cena</etym>, orig., <sense id="n7354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dining-room</hi>, usu. in an upper story; hence, <hi rend="ital">an upper story</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an upper room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a garret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attic</hi> (later, the dwelling of the poorer class of people): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi cubabant cubiculum, ubi cenabant cenaculum vocitabant. Posteaquam in superiore parte cenitare coeperunt, superioris domūs universa cenacula dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=162" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 162</bibl></cit> Müll.: cenacula dicuntur, ad quae scalis ascenditur (the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(perw=(on</foreign>), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=54:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 54, 6</bibl> ib.; cf. Liv 39, 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Agr 2, 35, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:18" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:41" default="NO">8, 2, 41</bibl> pr.; 9, 3, 5, § 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4323 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7354.1" n="II" level="1"> Transf, like <foreign lang="greek">u(perw=(on</foreign>: maxima caeli, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 7</bibl> (Ann. v. 61 Vahl.); cf. in Plaut. humorously of the abode of Jupiter: in superiore qui habito cenaculo, Plaut Am. 3, 1, 3. <cb n="CENO" /></sense></entryFree>
cenaeum: <entryFree id="n7355" type="main" key="Ce_naeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēnaeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*khnai=on a)/kron</foreign>, <sense id="n7355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the north-western point of the island of Eubœa</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cape Litar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 63</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Cenœum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 136</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cenaticus: <entryFree id="n7356" type="main" key="ce_na_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnātĭcus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caen-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cena</etym>, <sense id="n7356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a dinner</hi> (very rare): est illic mi una spes cenatica (i. e. cenandi), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 36</bibl>.—In late Lat. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnātĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the money given instead of food</hi> (to soldiers, priests, etc.), <hi rend="ital">commutation money</hi>, Cod. Th. 7, 4, 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 38, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 171, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cenatio: <entryFree id="n7357" type="main" key="ce_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnātĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caen-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (lit. an eating, dining), meton. (like cena, II. C.), <sense id="n7357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dining-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dining-hall</hi> (post-Aug. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 10</bibl> and 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 12, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 90, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:115:8" default="NO">115, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:13:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 4, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 77, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl> <hi rend="ital">bis.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:183" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:59:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 59, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cenatiuncula: <entryFree id="n7358" type="hapax" key="ce_na_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnātĭuncŭla</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caen-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small dining-room</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 30, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cenator: <entryFree id="n7359" type="gloss" key="ce_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>) [ceno], <sense id="n7359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a diner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guest</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">deipnhth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
cenatorius: <entryFree id="n7360" type="main" key="ce_na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnātōrĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caen-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to dinner</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">to the table</hi> (only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fames,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. Jun. 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnātōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">dinner dress</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:87:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 87, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:135" default="NO">14, 135</bibl> tit.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:2:34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 2, 34</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number> also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnātōrĭ-um</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = cenatio, <hi rend="ital">a dining-room</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2493</bibl>; cf. cenatorium, <foreign lang="greek">oi)/khma, deipnhth/rion</foreign>, Gloss. Cyr.</sense></entryFree>
cenaturio: <entryFree id="n7361" type="main" key="ce_na_tu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnātŭrĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caen-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <sense id="n7361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. desid.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to have an appetite for dinner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:77:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 77, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cenatus: <entryFree id="n7362" type="main" key="ce_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnātus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caen-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. ceno <sense id="n7362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cenchreae: <entryFree id="n7363" type="main" key="Cenchre^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cenchrĕae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kegxre/ai</foreign>, <sense id="n7363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the three harbors of Corinth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Saronic Gulf</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kenkri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 10</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n7363.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cenchraeus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-rēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Cenchreœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:60" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: sinus, <hi rend="ital">the Saronic Gulf</hi>, Porphyr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cenchreis: <entryFree id="n7364" type="main" key="Cenchre_i^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cenchrēĭs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n7364.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Cinyras and mother of Myrrha</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 435</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 58" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7364.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cenchris: <entryFree id="n7365" type="greek" key="cenchris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cenchris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">kegxri/s</foreign>. <sense id="n7365.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of hawk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:143 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 52, 73, § 143 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:127" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 38, § 127</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7365.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi> (cf. Passow under <foreign lang="greek">kegxri/as</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a kind of spotted serpent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 90, § 245</bibl> (<case>acc.</case> cenchrim); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 712</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cenchrltis: <entryFree id="n7366" type="greek" key="cenchrltis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cenchrltis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kegxri=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n7366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a millet stone</hi>, a kind of precious stone now unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 188</bibl> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cenchrius: <entryFree id="n7367" type="main" key="Cenchri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cenchrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-chrĕus</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ke/gxrios</foreign>, <sense id="n7367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Ionia near Ephesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cenchros: <entryFree id="n7368" type="greek" key="cenchro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cenchrŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ke/gxros</foreign> (millet), <sense id="n7368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown kind of precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cenimagni: <entryFree id="n7369" type="main" key="Ceni_magni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cenīmagni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a British tribe in Norfolk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Suffolk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Cambridge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cenina: <entryFree id="n7370" type="gloss" key="Ceni_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cenīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Caenina.</entryFree>
cenito: <entryFree id="n7371" type="main" key="ce_ni^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēnĭto</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caen-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n7371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [ceno], <hi rend="ital">to dine often</hi> or <hi rend="ital">much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be accustomed to dine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dine</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n7371.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si foris cenitarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; 9, 16, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 50, § 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in superiore parte aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=162" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 162</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnunquam et in publico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:2 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 2 al.</bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: cenitatur, <hi rend="ital">one dines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patentibus januis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7371.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To dine upon;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulas sacrificialis cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, 1, p. 217</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ceno: <entryFree id="n7372" type="main" key="ce_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēno</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">caen-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">coen-</orth>), <itype>āvi</itype> (e. g. Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 24 al.</bibl>; acc. to Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:25:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 25, 7</bibl>, also cenatus sum, but of that only the <sense id="n7372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part.</hi> cenatus is in use; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, and cf. poto and prandeo), <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cena]. </sense><sense id="n7372.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take a meal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eat</hi> (class., and very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">libenter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenavi modo, Plant. Am. 1, 1, 154: lepide nitideque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: bene, Lucil l. l.; <cb n="CENS" /> cf. belle, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:34:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 34, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:35:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 35, 4</bibl></cit> spes bene cenandi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:166" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 166</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene, libenter, recte, frugaliter, honeste... prave, nequiter, turpiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:6:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 6, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lauto paratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:13 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 13 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 3</bibl>; Appius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:235 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 235 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. 2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Ter. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 31</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n7372.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud eum cenatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 14, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7372.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: cenatus, <hi rend="ital">that has taken food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having dined</hi> (class.): cenatus ut pransus, ut potus, ut lotus, id est confectā coenā, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 94, 14 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenati atque appoti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid causae excogitari potest, cur te lautum voluerit, cenatum noluerit occidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2</bibl>. 16, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 61</bibl> (cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 633).—</sense><sense id="n7372.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to make a meal of something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to eat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dine upon</hi> (so only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Plaut. and Hor.): cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 168</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patinas omasi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem fercula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:17:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 17, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:142" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 51, 72, § 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olla cenanda Glyconi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:9" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7372.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: divorum adulteria, i. e. <hi rend="ital">represents at table</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl> (v. the passage in connection).—* </sense><sense id="n7372.6" n="C" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass in feasting or banqueting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenatae noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
